See why most Civil War combat was close-range firefights … or maybe you can find a way to change that!

Crucible of Courage includes five scenarios, all historical battles with their own maps and counters for the actual units, each a different view on the tactical details of the American Civil War.

Crucible of Courage scenarios:

1st Manassas (Virginia, July 21, 1861, the opening moments of the battle, Burnside’s 2nd RI vs The Louisiana Tigers)
Athens (Missouri, August 5, 1861, local militia, street-fighting, and hollowed logs as cannon)
James Island (SC, June 3, 1862, the Union’s initial attempt to attack Charleston by land)
Chickamauga (Georgia, September 18, 1862; Wilder's Brigade, armed with repeateres, holds the bridge against two brigades from Lidell's Division.
James Island, (SC, July 16 1863, the 54th Massachusetts Colored Regiment gets its baptism under fire

Crucible of Courage is designed for quick learning and easy play, a system that has almost unlimited possibilities. Game rules are short, but there are lots of charts and tables to cover every aspect of battle at this micro level. Playing time is 2-4 hours for any scenario.
26751.name: Crucible of Courage

26752.description: Module for Starfire (3rd Edition) covering all aspects of the Starfire Universe. It contained scenarios, fiction, and clarifications of rules and ship design and strategy.
26752.name: Starfire: Sky Marshal #1

26753.name: Battle of Leyte Gulf
26753.description:
Mini-game.

Comprises 4 scenarios of the different phases of the battle:
1) Entrance of Leyte
2) San Bernardino Strait
3) The Chase
4) Surigao Strait

110 Counters.

26754.name: Schöne weite Welt
26754.description:
There are six boards showing the 6 continents (Australia also shows Indonesia and Papua New Guinea). The boards show the maps of the areas. With each boards comes a set of tiles that can be placed on to the map to form a grip. These tiles show a nice drawn version of the map in front (with some scenes and tourist attractions of the area) and on the back there is a reference to cities or other landmarks corresponding to the tiles place on the board.
Each player now gets a board and tiles, shuffle the tiles and start to be the first to complete the grid. If you do this by the front side (puzzling) or by the backside (looking for the places and using the front only to see where its correct) is up to you. Player finishing first wins. Of course, everybody should play with every continent.
And of course, quite a lot of the countries have changed since this game was published.

26755.name: Sailors Knot
26755.description: Its basically "Shut the box" but in addition you have to tie the knot thats corresponding to the number rolled. If you fail to do so in the time limit you are also busted.

26756.name: Axiom
26756.description:
In Axiom players compete in the art of knowing dictum and slogans. It can be played with two players to a maximum of six teams consisting of many players.

The idea of the game is simple. You're being asked a question. If you know it you can progress three steps forward on the score board. If you know it after you've given a set of choices, you only take one step forward.

The first player who reaches the end of the score track wins.

26758.name: Emergency Ward 10
26758.description: Game based on a hit T.V. series on English television in the 1960's called Emergency Ward 10. One of, if not the first of the television hospital soap type series. The game includes four counters, four vehicles, a spinner and playing instruction leaflet. You move around a circular board beginning on the outside rim and finishing on the inside rim. The spinners move number determines what happens to you on this recreation of the show.

26760.name: Triumph of the Will
26760.description:
Miniature Wargame rules for revolutionary warfare 1914 to 1936
Concentrating on the revolutionary warfare of the Spartakist Revolution, and the Russian and Spanish Civil Wars, these rules emphasize the importance of willpower amongst your troops. Small numbers of highly motivated troops will outperform hordes of disinterested conscripts in these vicious and unforgiving conflicts.
Armored trains, the International Brigades, desperate men fighting for their version of the truth are all here in rules that capture the very crusading essence of these political conflicts.

26761.name: Funny Things Happen
26761.description:
A pretty simple board game, the object of which is to leave your home and get to work by taking advantage of good squares and avoiding bad hazard squares. The game box features some very nice seaside postcard style illustrations on both the box and the game board.

Looks like it could be a variant on Snakes and Ladders

26762.name: If the Lord Spares Us
26762.description:
Miniature Wargame rules for the First World War in the Middle East.

“…Til we meet again, if the Lord Spares Us”. So ends the last letter written home from Gallipoli veteran 202537 Lance Sergeant Albert Skinner, 2/4th Royal West Kent Regiment, just a few weeks before his death in the hills near Tel Khuweilfe, a few miles north east of Beersheba, Palestine on 4th November 1917. These rules are dedicated to Albert and all those other poor sods who are still out there.

It's a long way to Tipperary but whether you're fighting your way up Anzac Cove, sipping Pimms as part of Townshend's Regatta up the Tigris, marching through Jerusalem with Allenby, or bouncing on a flea-ridden camel on the route to Damascus with Lawrence of Arabia these rules will enable you to pack up your troubles and take the fight to Johnny Turk. Away from the quagmire of the Western Front ITLSU proves that brigade level games the Great War in the Middle East have components of everything; camels, arab war bands, sweeping cavalry attacks, opposed beach landings, massed machine guns, gas attacks, tanks, armored cars, fighting in the mirage, water shortages, trench assaults, river gunboats - and enough command and control dilemmas to test the most cunning Pasha.The opportunities it provides are boundless. ITLSU makes every wargame a Great War game!

26763.name: Great Battles of World War Two: Volume 3 – Invasion '40
26763.description: Bruce McFarlane's 8th miniatures guide-book covering large battles. The third in the Great Battles of World War Two Series. Each stand represents a company with maneuver elements being battalions. The scale and scope of the game allows multi-divisional actions simulating many days - not minutes. French, Dutch, Belgian and German 1940 History, Organization, Weapons and Tactics. Six scenarios including Fortress Holland, Eben Emael, Dinant, Sedan and Arras.

26764.name: Algernon Pulls it Off
26764.description: Miniature wargame rules for Great War air combat. These rules are a development of the Too Fat Lardies Second World War air combat rules Bag the Hun.

26765.description:
Miniature wargame rules for Infantry Action in Vietnam 1965 - 1968.
Charlie Company is designed to serve as an ongoing miniatures campaign game which reflects those peculiar circumstances that were a part of Infantry Combat in Vietnam. As such the rules are designed to focus on the Infantry Company and its supporting arms, and not on Special Forces, Riverine or Armored Cavalry actions. As a game system it can be played with anywhere from 3 players to as many as 20, with one person serving as umpire and being responsible for setting up and running the game.
26765.name: Charlie Company: Infantry Combat in Vietnam, 1965-1972
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples and Miniatures Episode 11 - Good Morning Vietnam!

26766.description:
Miniature wargame rules for the Vietnam War. Bodycount is for 2-6 players plus an umpire. The umpire controls the VC and NVA forces and these are not deployed on the table until spotted.

Expanded by:

The Face of Battle: The Hill Battles – Khe Sanh, Vietnam: 1967
26766.name: Bodycount: Wargames Rules for the Vietnam War

26767.description: Buckle For Your Dust! is a set of explanations, rules and scenario data for small unit actions (at platoon or squad level) set in the 'American' war in Vietnam. It is designed to be used with miniatures, vehicles and terrain in any scale although scales such as HO/OO, 1/72 or 20mm / 15mm are recommended. Larger scenarios may be played with scales around 1/300 or 5mm.
26767.name: Buckle For Your Dust! Wargaming in Miniature: Vietnam 1965-1973

26768.name: Stixx
26768.description: Stixx is an abstract strategy/bluffing game, where the main goal is to obtain as many stixx of your own color as possible, while preventing opposing players from doing the same. Each player picks a color token at the beginning and keeps it secret. During a turn, a player can do one of three things 1) obtain a stixx touching the single grey stixx, 2) reveal their color and pick up two stixx, or 3) guess another player's secret color and, if correct, collect two stixx. If the player guesses wrong, she loses her turn. The winner is the person who has the most stixx in their color, with tie breakers going to the player with the most stixx of one other color, and then the player who's secret color was revealed last.

26769.description:
In this 1966 Transogram game - Blondie, The Hurry Scurry Game which is based on the long running Blondie cartoon strip. Blondie and Dagwood figures dance their way around the board following Arthur Murray style dance pattern footprints.
Game comes with a spinner and cardboard figures of the characters. Game has both English and French translations of the rules.
26769.name: Blondie Hurry Scurry Game

26770.name: Stingray
26770.description: Sting Ray by Transogram. The object of the game is to move through the underwater maze using spin and move. Little cardboard pieces are used to signify where you are in the maze. Tie breaker pieces are used to determine who gets to move to a particular spot.

26771.name: Magilla Gorilla
26771.description:
This is a spin and move game based on the 1964 cartoon show of the same name. In Magilla Gorilla, the protagonist spent his time languishing in the front display window of Mr. Peebles' pet shop, eating bananas and being a drain on the businessman's finances. Mr. Peebles marked down Magilla's price considerably, but Magilla was invariably only purchased for a short time, typically by some thieves who needed a gorilla to break into a bank or by an advertising company looking for a mascot for their new product. The customers always ended up returning Magilla, forcing Mr. Peebles to return their money. Magilla ended each episode with his catchphrase, "We'll try again next week."

The object of the game is to acquire Parrots, Cats and Monkeys which help to get you to the finish line instead of being returned to Mr. Peeples.

26772.name: Kentucky Jones
26772.description: This game is based on a television show from the period which starred Dennis Weaver (Chester of Gunsmoke fame). It is a spin the spinner and move game.

26773.name: Tongue Tanglers
26773.description:
Tongue Tanglers™ is a hilarious tongue-twister party game for up to 10 players. We don’t give you tongue-twisters to say - you create them for the your opponents from a set of cards.

Simple to play but tough to say, each player draws a card and places it into any position on any other player’s word pad. That player must now say their new tongue-twister as many times as they can in 10 seconds. Each successful read scores a point, but any mistake (and they’re usually funny!) ends the turn. So read slowly, or read fast, one mistake will be your last!

Tongue Tanglers includes card tray, 10 word pads, scoring markers, timer, instructions, and cards containing over 900 words specially selected for hours of hilarious party fun. 2-10 players, ages 8 to adult.

26774.name: Grand Prix
26774.description: Game comes with two tracks. Each player uses a steering wheel to 'drive' their cars around the track. The steering wheel operates a magnet on the underside of the track for guiding racing cars around the circuit. The game includes four cars, two for each player. There are a number of track side obstacles including hedges, walls, fences, bridges, tunnels, bridge walls. First player to complete the circuit is the winner.

26775.description: Miniature wargame rules for the Black Powder weapons era including the French and Indian War, American War of Independence and Napoleonic Wars. These are skirmish rules based on 2 Hour Wargames Chain Reaction 2.0 system.
26775.name: Black Powder Battles
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode #28

26776.name: La Mer
26776.description: Game about sea life. French author of the game Alain Bombard, worked as an oceanographic specialist in Monaco and did many expeditions including documentaries with Jacques Cousteau. This game is based upon his expeditions and tries to make people clear that the sea covers 71% of the earth and that it's health is important to us. The game has 25 cards and 4 pawns. It's a hard to find collectors game that covers fauna, flora, navigation and secrets of the sea.

26777.description: Miniature wargame rules for Medieval skirmishes. The rules are developed from but different to the 2 Hour Wargames Chain Reaction 2.0 system. The rules include army lists for the major Medieval wars and both a campaign system and siege rules.
26777.name: Montjoie!

26778.name: Machina II: Przeładowanie
26778.description: "Machina II: Przeladowanie" is a re-edition of very popular game called "Machina" published in 2002 in Poland. Every player is an Engineer working on his unique prototype. The aim of the game is to construct your own prototype using particular Elements (tiles) listed on your Prototype Card. Lack of Elements in game makes players steal and sabotage each other on almost every turn!

26780.name: Reise ins Tierreich
26780.description: Travel around the world over the 5 continents and discover about the exotic animals living in the places that U pass through. The game was developed by animal professor Heinz Sielmann. It contains a board with the world on it, 4 pawns, 4 dice (with the nr. 6 replaced by a color, 60 animal cards and 40 chips.

26781.description:
Chuck ducked under the flying burger as he made his way to his seat. The Jocks were at it again, he said to himself, sitting down next to the other geeks. Just then a milk shake flew overhead and exploded high over the Preppie's table. With a howl the Cheerleader leaped up and started screaming about how hard it was to get chocolate out of cashmere. Then it begun, the food started to fly between the tables, Jocks throwing chips and cola cans while the Preppies laid in with hot dogs and yogurt cups. Soon the whole cafeteria as a mess of flying food and gangs of students dodging and thrown their lunch.

Chuck sat lower in his chair, trying to avoid being hit and continued to eat his PB&J. That's when the bagel hit the fan, and he was hit with a cup of soap. Now it was war Chuck said to himself as he gathered up food of his own to throw.

This is food Fight, a fun, fast game of insanity. Can your team of teenagers out fight their dreaded and hated foes as the food flies and the fun begins.

One of Bad Baby's many Mini-game, Food Fight will allow you to make a mess and still have fun.
26781.name: Food Fight

26782.description:
Julia watched as her foe summoned a Hydra with a flourish and a puff of green smoke. Jarrird had always been a bit of a show off Julia thought as she watched the many-headed beast slither about on the ground before its new master.

No matter she smiled, her enemy could be as showy as he wanted to be, it would not stop her from crushing him under her boot heel. Knowing the Hydra would still be a bit dazed from its master's summoning spell, and thus vulnerable, Julia quickly sent her Goblins in to kill it. The small green warriors each drew their short sword and rushed the larger creature, each yelling a shrill battle cry as they charged. Julia knew the little green Goblins would have no chance against the many heads of the Hydra, but she hoped to at least hurt it a little bit so her Minotaur could finish the job. Once his last defender had been taken care of, well Jarrird would be next.

This is Conjurer, a new Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Play a skilled wizard as they battle other spell casters in a duel of summoning. Each magician has the skill to summon various monsters to their aid, monsters they then may send into battle in a desperate attempt to kill their foe before they themselves are dragged down. Skill, cunning and a little bit of luck is need to be a successful conjurer and thus master over all those that would stand against you.
26782.name: Conjurer

26783.description:
Ensign Jones grabbed a handrail as the federation missile slammed into the aft hull of the ship. The explosion rocked the ship he and the others were encased in, shacking it like some small child playing with a toy.

"Damn", he thought as he pulled himself along the passage tube, "Another hit like that and we might not survive this engagement." With the gravity turned off for battle stations, Jones found it hard to reach his station. Still he managed to make his way down the tube towards the beam weapon's controls. The captain wanted to make a quick pass on the federation carrier before it could launch all of its fighters. Jones thought it was a suicidal run at best, but the captain had been lucky so far and she might just pull it off, might Jones thought as the next missile hit home?

This is Space Armada, the newest Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions. Across our solar system, in the distant future, battle two mighty space fleets. The imperialistic Federation means to bring the whole of system under their sway. Meanwhile the Colonial Fleets, each a small, independent fleet in its own right have banded together to stop this move by the Federation. The fate of the human race now lies in your hands as you command one of those fleets. Will the Federation bring order and law to the solar system, or will the independent colonies and mining outposts remain free.

Space Armada is a fast past game of space fleet battles, wages across the solar system. Players will need to be decisive in their game play, all the while trying to protect their fleet's ships, waiting for the right moment to strike.
26783.name: Space Armada

26784.name: Stock Block
26784.description:
Stock Block - "The Original, Individualized Game for Any City"
[from the rules]

The idea of the game Stock Block is to purchase, trade and sell various stock certificates and stock shares (relating to historical, significant and economic landmarks in particular cities) in an effort to "crash" and "29" your opponents. Each player shrewdly conducts his "board business" in an effort to force other players into liquidating their stock shares and crash certificates when they do not have enough cash to pay the interest charges on their stock certificate squares.

Stock Block games now available for: Albuquerque, Atlanta, Baltimore, Charlotte, Chicago, Cincinnati, Cleveland, Columbus, Dallas, Dayton, Denver, Detroit, Fort Worth, Houston, Indianapolis, Los Angeles, Lexington, Louisville, Memphis, Milwaukee, Nevada, New York, Oklahoma City, Philadelphia, Phoenix, Portland, Richmond, Salt Lake City, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Spokane, Twin Cities, U.S.A., Washington D.C., Montreal, Ottawa, Quebec, Toronto, Winnipeg, Vancouver, Barbados, Bermuda, Caribbean and Oxford.

Packaging, construction and distinctive game design are trademarks of J.F.M. Games Company's Stock Exchange Board Game, Registered in the US. Patent Office, Great Britain, Canada and Japan. Marca Registrada. Copyright 1976, 1977, 1978, 1979, 1980 by John F. Majors.

26785.name: Pingo Pongo
26785.description: Each player gets dealt a hand of Pingo cards, Pongo cards and Pingo-Pongo cards. If your opponent plays a Pingo card, you must play a Pongo card. It's back and forth fun for everyone. Play a Pingo-Pongo card and win the pile. Whoever wins the most cards, wins the game.

26786.name: Number Rumba
26786.description:
The game box contains 2 identical little stands each with 9 number blocks and a pack of example-cards.
The cards are numbered from 1 to 24 (easy..difficult).
When a card is placed on the table, the 2 players try to make the example witch is shown on that card as quickly as possible.
The fastest player wins that card.
Then the next card comes on the table etc.

Rules: You may just move one block at the time and the stones may only be put on the bars of the stand.
Not in your hands or on the table!!
Each bar can have 3 blocks max.

It's also a nice game to play for 1 player.

26787.description: This game from Standard Toycraft represents the Original TV show by this name. The TV show starred Jay North as Dennis, with first Joseph Kearns, who died in 1962 and then Gale Gordon as Mr. Wilson. The object of the game is catch Dennis as he moves around the neighborhood. Players take the part of Dennis' friends Margaret and Tommy and his mom and dad Henry and Alice in this roll and move effort to catch Dennis.
26787.name: Dennis the Menace

26788.name: Bastards Inc.
26788.description:
Ba$tard$ Inc. is a satirical boardgame for 2-6 players. Each player controls an international mega corporation and tries to manipulate politics, the economy, and the media for profit. You can even start wars to earn money, but be careful as things can get out of hand...

Some features of the game:

- Corporations have different strengths and weaknesses, which their player must choose at the beginning of the game. This makes different strategies possible.

- Action cards allow the players to manipulate the game in various ways, damage their competitors, or earn money through shady deals.

Ba$tard$ Inc. is available online for free (see the link section) as a print-and-play kit. You also need to supply some components.

26789.description: This game is based upon the players drawing a mission card, and attempting to complete this mission. Players do not reveal their missions to the other players. There are 3 different classes of ships to choose from. Players can see what their opponents ships are, and narrow down the potential mission of their opponent. As the game progresses, players attempt to block their opponents from reaching their goals. The goal may be to abduct different types of earthlings, or destroying cities (to name a few). On each city, there is a marker that the player flips to determine how many cards to pull, or perhaps damage to the ship. An additional angle is not all of the cards drawn are not necessarily good, so, it may not always be advantageous to be on a city that is giving a lot of cards.
26789.name: Aussie Rules Super Earthling Abductor

26790.name: Fussball Weltmeisterschaft 1974
26790.description: Soccer game released by an Italian publisher. Based upon the 1974 world cup. No dice.

26791.name: Sharivari
26791.description: In this French party game, which features illustrations by David Cochard, players are divided in 2 or more teams. The goal is to search a word that fits an imposed theme. The game is played without pencil & paper but does include 32 recto-verso cards, 2 rule cards and 40 chips.

26792.description:
Card & Dice Game for 2-6 Players. Theme: The Political Cauldron of Warring factions of Ireland in the 10th and 11th Centuries. A game of constantly shifting Alliances.
Raid and lay siege to your opponents. Slaughter your Foes and take all their Gold. Simple Rules and Quick Play. A copy of the rules is available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/WKOI.html
26792.name: Warrior Kings of Ireland

26793.name: Rehab: A Wild Drinking Game
26793.description:
Description from the Kheper Games website:

You and the other players are raging alcoholics. You try and try and try to correct your drinking problem in REHAB, but you keep falling off the wagon. Whether it's a trip to Willy's Bar and Grill, Club Swank, the New Year's Eve Party or the Fraternity Party, you just can't seem to resist temptation. You'll travel around the gameboard landing in and falling out of REHAB until finally someone successfully defeats his or her addiction to alcohol (by collecting five gold stars). Along your road to recovery, you may have to reveal personal information about yourself, sing your favorite television theme song or even dance with a lampshade on your head. You may have a drunken hookup, develop cirrhosis of the liver or even get thrown in jail for drunk and disorderly conduct. You are an alcoholic and you're expected to act like one, and that includes lots of drinks. For 2-6 adults.

26794.name: LOGacta Chart Soccer
26794.description:
Using charts, dice and cards, you can create league and cup competitions for British clubs, and also the European championships and World Cup for international sides.
There are 8 season charts that allow you to play 6 club competitions

16 team Super League
F.A. Cup
League Cup
European Cup
European Cup Winners Cup
UEFA Cup

Each match is played by rolling 2 dice, one for each team, from the seven different colored dice with the game, using the Dice Selector Chart to determine which dice each team rolls. Only one roll is needed for most matches with the number on each die (range 0-5) the amount of goals scored for each side.



2009 Version now in design by tipsterchallenge.comMore details at ricpdx2000@aol.com

Tipsterchallenge.com

boardgameimplementation: Kadesh:  Mobile Warfare in the Ancient Middle East
boardgamehonor: 2008 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine-Published Boardgame Nominee
26795.description:
Miniature armies - carefully painted and labeled with unit names, strengths, and abilities - have been found in Egyptian tombs, suggesting that "wargaming" goes back a long time.

Of those miniature armies, no units take more precedence than the chariots - the "panzers" of their day. Keep in mind that horses of this period were too small to "ride" with a man on their back in a "cavalry" way. Only chariots offered a battle platform faster than sandals, and provided the "shock troops" of their day and a platform to designate the aristocracy and elite peoples. Alexander and the Roman legions might sneeze at chariot power... but not for another 900 years!

Kadesh must be the chariot battle of all time. Sources conflict and disagree, but there may have been as many as 5000 chariots in this twisted, confused, and bloody battle, fought to determine the borders between Egypt and the Hittite confederacy...

As an early example of "spin," Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II claimed a tremendous victory and the total vanquishing of the Hittite army... although he also signed a peace treaty that left the disputed city of Kadesh in the hands of the Hittites and never returned. Hmm. (A later and more formal treaty between Ramses and the next Hittite king is reproduced on the walls of the United Nations, as one of the first recorded international peace treaties. Ramses did not get Kadesh with that one either.)

Now you can take the reins and lead your lines/lions into battle. Day of the Chariot: Kadesh offers a classic design by Gene Dickens fully updated into a tactical view of one of the most-discussed battles of middle eastern history, with 320 double-sided counters, 30 minute turns, and everything you need to play a system emphasizing command control and flexibility (or the lack thereof). Three distinct scenarios provide the battle that did happen (according to Ramses), the battle that both sides had "prearranged" to happen, and the smaller, more confused battle that historians think actually did happen. (You may be surprised how different the "same" battle can be!)
26795.name: Day of the Chariot: Kadesh

26796.name: Trails to Tremble By
26796.description: This Whitman game is subtitled "The Scarey {sic} Crossroads Game." This game was truly ahead of its time: it is a hexagonal tile laying game, with no board, for children. Each player selects 10 "spooky" tiles of either witches, monsters, ghosts, or buzzards, plus one crossroad and one tombstone. The first player then picks one of the 40 road tiles and places it in the center of the table. Each player then adds a road piece, making sure the road continues without a dead end or circling into itself. Every time you form a three-sided space, you fill it with one of your spooky tiles, making sure it does not block the road. After you have added 5 of your spooky tiles, add the tombstone, and then the rest of your pieces. The winner is the first to use all their pieces and add the Haunted House tile to the road.

26797.name: Dunce
26797.description:
The Dunce game is similar to Jumbolino, only in reverse. In Jumbolino players roll dice to be the first to construct a figure. In "Dunce," players spin a teetotum that has pictures of the dunce pieces as well as a lucky horseshoe pic. If a player puts together the whole dunce (stool, body, head, and cap - in that order), he/she is eliminated from the game; the winner is the last eliminated. The box also lists Rules for Teenagers and Adults, saying that they can play the old game of "Ghost" by adding letters to a word, with the player who completes the word having to add a part to his toy dunce.

The die has six sides. Two stools, one body, one head, one dunce's cap, and a lucky horseshoe. You have to assemble the body in order. If you get the lucky horseshoe then you skip a turn, but all your opponents have to put on their next body part.

This game is also similar to ScareCrow, which also has players building a figure in order, except that in that game the player who finishes first is the winner.

26798.name: BWAH!: Still Flyin'
26798.description: An expasion for BWAH! The game BWAH! is based on the game BANG! re-themed for the "Firefly" universe created by Joss Whedon. Not a standalone game, "Only a hoe-tze duh pee goo would try to play with only these cards." This expansion includes 9 more characters and 9 more cards. The characters cards feature some minor characters in the TV series including a Reaver character. In addition, two new symbols affecting game play are introduced.

26799.name: Criterium Degli Assi
26799.description: Italian cycling game that was released by a small publisher from Milan in the 1940's. Although the game mechanics are very straightforward, the game board features very nice graphics, especially considering the age of the game.

26800.name: La Gran Vuelta Ciclista en Casa
26800.description: Independent expensive Spanish cycling game that looks very good. It has 4 double sided boards and even innovative aspects like a service car (for each cycling team) and even road signs and a tunnel.

26801.name: Le Guidon d'Or
26801.description: Each player has one cyclist. At each turn the player rolls the dice and move his or her cyclist. The board has 63 squares, the kilometer-mark squares double your throw. The game is like The Game of Goose. The first player who lands exactly on space 63 wins the game.

26802.name: Itzuli Mitzuli
26802.description: Beautiful and very rare cycling game produced in the Basque area of Spain in the 1970s, with an important nationalist vindication component. There are six boards representing the seven territories (Behe Nafarra and Xiberua share a board) vindicated by Basque nationalism. The rules are in Euskara (Basque), Breton, Spanish, Catalan and French. The components of the game are quite geometrical: triangular wooden pegs represent the riders and the graphics on the cards are quite abstract.

26804.description:
(from Games Research/Design (GR/D) web site:)

Games Research/Design (GR/D) returns Europa to its roots and revisits the best selling Europa title Fire in the East. The new game covers the same time period as the older ones (summer of 1941 to the spring of 1942) but uses a completely new Soviet OB, a new map, and the latest rules for the Europa system.

Total War gives the Axis player the opportunity to see if he can improve on the massive offensive that pocketed and captured millions of Soviet soldiers. Can you take Moscow or Leningrad? Or are you condemned to suffer the Soviet winter short of victory? The Soviet player must build a strategic reserve large enough to stop the advancing Axis forces and throw them out of Russia. The Soviet player is aided by massive reinforcements that allow him to form new defensive lines in an attempt to slow down or stop the Axis armor thrusts.

Total War is a historical game on the German invasion of the Soviet Union, from summer 1941 to spring 1942. It charts the titanic struggle of the largest ground campaign in World War II, from the Axis offensives that brought the Germans to the gates of Moscow to the Soviet winter counteroffensive that hurled them back.

Total War is a two-player game. One side controls the forces of Germany and its allies while the other controls the forces of the Soviet Union. The maps cover Eastern Europe and the western USSR from the Arctic Ocean to the Black Sea, from the plains of Poland to the steppes along the Volga River. Ground units represent corps, divisions, brigades, regiments, and battalions. Air units represent groups of 40 to 120 aircraft. Naval units represent task forces of warships.

Total War is a complete remake and updating of the classic Europa game, Fire in the East. The game’s Soviet order of battle makes extensive use of formerly secret Kremlin information on the Red Army forces that fought the war. The game includes a Soviet order of battle for all of the USSR from 1939 to 1942 and is the more comprehensive game OB ever published on the Red Army in peace and war. The Axis order of battle also is updated, reflecting new research since the publication of Fire in the East. The rules for Total War incorporate the latest rules for the Europa system, with on-demand air power, armor effects, combined arms, and much more, recreating both the German blitzkrieg that captured entire Soviet armies and the Soviet deep operations that nearly splintered the invaders in the depth of the Russian winter."
26804.name: Total War

26805.name: Flippit
26805.description:
Flippit ... the word game you'll flip over!

A multi-player competitive solitaire alphabet card game of luck that reinforces correct spelling for kids of all ages.

Choose a name or word ... shuffle and deal only those cards letter-side down in a row.

Pick a card, any card - and, to follow the letter positions and spell it out ... flip it ... the more cards flipped and correctly repositioned in their proper spelling sequence, the more points acquired.

The most points scored, wins the game.

26806.description:
1829 Conversion Kits were published to allow owners of the 1829 Conversion Kit to play the other 18xx games without having to buy another complete game as many of the parts were common to both the Southern and the Northern games. As such, the Conversion Kits are not standalone games, but rather contains those parts unique to the other 1829 [Northern or Southern] - the board and the shares for the companies. A copy of 1829 Northern Board is required to use the 1829 Southern Conversion Kit or alternatively a Southern Board can be used with a Northern Conversion Kit.

The Southern Conversion Kit can be differentiated from a full copy of 1829 by the presence of a large sticker to the right of the 1829 name on the box stating "Conversion Kit. This is not a complete game." Whereas the Northern Conversion Kit had a larger diagonal sticker across the front of the box see picture. The inevitable scars left after removal of either sticker is the largest sign that this is the Conversion Kit and not the full game. However, on the side of the box where the Number of Players and Playing Time is indicated, there is also a sticker covering the Serial Number [Southern Kit] or no number at all [Northern kit].
boardgameversion: Hartland Trefoil North to South edition
Hartland Trefoil South to North edition
26806.name: 1829 Conversion Kit

26807.name: Les plus Beaux Tableaux du Monde
26807.description: Educational card game by Nathan about painters. The game contains 48 cards with lots of info about paintings and painters on it.

26808.name: Minéraux et Roches
26808.description: Educational card game with an archeology theme that appeared in the '80s about rocks and minerals. Game contains 48 cards with lots of info on it.

26809.description:
Zambezy ... a board game of strategic placement and points accumulation using luck of the draw and tactics.

The object is to accumulate points by placing or exposing pieces of the same colour on four adjacent spaces to form squares.

Pieces may be placed on top of others but only on opposing-colour pieces - maximum: 4 high.

Only same-colour pieces on the top tier of any 4 adjacent spaces forming a square score points.

There are 3 different colour exception pieces ... that may help or hinder!

Players only win points with their own colour pieces - even when one is placed by the opponent completing their square(s).

The player with the most points wins.

Contents
milled beech wood playing board (24cm x 38cm) with burnt in (branded) playing surface
71 custom-made plastic playing pieces: 1 clear + 1 green + 3 orange + 33 blue + 33 red
felt base
cloth bag
26809.name: Zambezy

26810.name: Tous pour un Maillot
26810.description: French cycling boardgame that appeared in the '80s or early '90s. The green gameboard has France on it with a road that represents the Tour de France. The game has wonderful metal cyclists that in 4 different colors, each for a player. There also is a cyclist with a yellow jersey to represent the leader and a rider with a blue cap to represent the leader in the Dauphiné Liberé race. The game has roll and move mechanics and it comes with 2 dice.

26811.name: Quel est ce bruit?
26811.description: Quel est ce bruit? (What is this noise?) is an educational game for learning French (intended for those whose native language is French). It consists of 6 boards of various scenes (e.g. camping scene). Using a cassette tape, you would play sounds/words and place disks as you identified these.

26812.name: Tumbling Bob the Builder
26812.description: In this game players add buckets to Bob the Builder's ladder trying not to tip him over. The object is to be the first to get rid of all your buckets. Targeted at the 4+ audience.

26813.name: De Wraak van Seth: Papyrus
26813.description: A long time ago Gods were disputing who would rule the world. Horus would claim power on Egypt and Seth on the desert. Seth wasn't content with this and would soon take revenge. This game is based upon a comic book and cartoon of Papyrus. It's aimed at children starting from age 6.

26814.name: Scenario Sports
26814.description:
"The Game You Play, While The Game Is On"

From 2 and up to an unprecedented 50 players, ages 8 & up of all genders, will have a blast winning play money throughout the telecast. For example:

When a soft drink commercial is shown......YOU WIN MONEY!
If a commentator says a certain word.........YOU WIN MONEY!
If an official/referee falls down...................YOU WIN MONEY!

There are 51 fun filled scenario cards in the game and when a "scenario" occurs and you hold the corresponding scenario card, you will win the amount of money printed on the card...The player with the most money at the end of the game, WINS!

The special feature of this game is that YOU can choose on how long you want to play the scenario game. You may play by periods/quarters, the whole game or YOU may set a TIME LIMIT on the scenario game.

You do NOT have to play through a 3 hour telecast.
Another special feature of the game is that you may start or stop play at any point during the telecast of the game.
To view the 4 easy direction on how to play, you may visit our web-site at http://www.scenariosports.com

26815.name: Kong Power Slam Battle Card Game
26815.description:
Each player begins with a hand of five cards. The cards have either a number (from 2-8- some of which also have special powers) or a picture of Kong. In each round of the battle, players simultaneously selects a card and places it face down in front of him. The cards are then revealed and, in general, the card with the higher number wins the round (with some exceptions due to Kong cards and special powers.)
The winner of the round either moves the Kong figure to the first space on his side of the board if he did not win the last round or advances Kong a space if he won the last round. The loser gets to draw a card. In the case of a tie, both players draw two cards.
A player must win three rounds in a row in order to win the game. If the deck is exhausted before someone has won 3 in a row, the player who has won the most rounds (tallied by keeping the cards from won battles in front of him) wins. A player can also lose by running out of cards.

26816.name: Monopoly: Cricket Australia Charity
26816.description:
Monopoly variant.
UK edition board square: replacement.
Mayfair: Don Bradman; Park Lane: Steve Waugh;
Regent St: Ricky Ponting; Oxford St: Shane Warne; Bond St: Glenn McGrath;
Coventry St: Adam Gilchrist; Leicester Square: Justin Langer; Picadilly: Matthew Hayden;
The Strand: Mike Hussey; Fleet St: Andrew Symonds; Trafalgar Square: Simon Katich;
Vine St: Brett Lee; Bow St: Michael Clarke; Marlborough St: Shane Watson;
Pall Mall: Damien Martyn; Northumberland Ave: Jason Gillespie; Whitehall: Michael Kasprowicz;
Euston St: Shaun Tait; Pentonville Rd: Daniel Cullen; Angel Islington: Stuart Clark;
Whitechapel: Brad Hogg; Old Kent Rd: Stuart McGill;
King's Cross: Mark Taylor; Marylebone: Greg Chappell; Fenchurch St: Ian Chappell; Liverpool St: Allan Border
Electric Company: Ashes Urn; Water Works: Allan Border Medal;
Income Tax: LBW; Super Tax: Caught Behind;
Chance: One Day; Community Chest: Test.

26817.name: Monopoly: Dallas Cowboys
26817.description:
The historic 'Dallas Cowboys and the world’s most popular board game have teamed up to create the ultimate fantasy for fans of all ages. This incredible NFL franchise has won a phenomenal five Super Bowls and its roster includes some of the greatest gridiron players of all time. Buy, sell and trade the most significant players, coaches and historic moments in the history of the Cowboys, including Michael Irvin, Randy White, Bob Lilly and Tom Landry. Get ready to wheel and deal your way to the ultimate Cowboys team of all time!

Comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens: Cowboys Cheerleader, Football, Referee’s Whistle, Quarterback, Cowboys Helmet and Linebacker.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6

26818.name: Monopoly: New England Patriots Collector's
26818.description:
Experience Patriots excitement in and out of the stadium in the New England Patriots Collector's Edition of the Monopoly game. Buy, sell and trade the Patriots all-time greatest players from Tom Brady, Steve Grogan and the legendary John Hannah.

Own the most memorable games like Berry the Bears, Squish the Fish and the Snow Plow Game.

Compete to own the ultimate Patriots team in this completely customized version of the world’s best selling board game.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6

Pewter Tokens:

Quarterback
Linebacker
Football
Cheerleader
Patriots Helmet
Whistle

26819.name: Minus 13
26819.description:
Minus 13 is easiest described as a multi-player shut the box. Players take turns rolling 3 dice and removing colored chips from hexagonal pyramid that is made from six triangular parts. The players total up the numbers on the dice and remove the colored chip that sits on the corresponding number. If there is no chip left on that number then the player takes any number of chips from numbers that add up to the total of the roll. When a 13 is rolled the player must take chip that sits on top of the pyramid that is worth negative 13 points. If a player is unable to take chips that add up to his or her number (ie. another 13 is rolled) then they must pass one of their colored chips to the person on their left. In this way the "minus 13" chip can be passed on.

At the end of the game, each player rolls dice to determine how many points each colored chip is worth. The player holding the "minus 13" chip subtracts the appropriate amount of points and the person with the most points wins.

26820.name: Scooby-doo! Mystery Card Game
boardgamepublisher: The United States Playing Card Company
26820.description: Scooby Doo Mystery Card Game, capture a villain but don't get caught. Features, Scooby and the gang and of course the villains. For ages 4 and up.

26821.name: El Tour
26821.description: Spanish cycling game based on the Tour de France. The game uses dice but also some cards that are used for a sprint, there also is a flat tire card. The game also includes a double sided board with different stages, it even includes some roadsigns.

26822.name: World Safari
26822.description:
World Safari is a combination of 2 educational games on the same game board. It is a geography-based trivia game designed to encourage children to learn about the various sizes, locations and characteristics of many countries in the world. It also seeks to familiarize players with the map of the world.

One game consists of players naming countries and capitals on the maps for points. A first-time answer scores more points than a second-time answer coming after a prompt. Scores are tallied when all the countries have been named.

The other game is played Cranium-style, where players must answer certain trivia questions aided by Visual Aid cards that ask for the location or name of certain buildings. When these are answered correctly, the player moves forward on the board. The player to reach the Finish square first is the winner.

26823.name: La Batalla de las Ardenas
26823.description:
The Ardennes Offensive, officially named the Battle of the Ardennes by the U.S. Army (and known to the general public as the Battle of the Bulge), started on December 16, 1944. The goal of these operations as planned by the Germans was to split the British and American Allied line in half, capturing Antwerp and then proceeding to encircle and destroy four Allied armies, forcing the Western Allies to negotiate a peace treaty in the Axis' favor.

This NAC game represents the important battle of WWII.

26824.name: 6-TAC
26824.description: 6-TAC is a six player version of TAC. Most of the rules are identical to those for regular TAC: as in TAC, players play in teams - three teams of two, or two teams of three - racing to bring their marbles into Home. Movement is governed by cards, each player receiving five or six cards per round of play. A variety of special cards enliven the tactical play.

26825.name: Tic Tac Tony
26825.description:
Take turns placing your disc on Tony's tail. When you flick the tail, the disc flies onto his back and lands in one of the holes. The first player to get three in a row wins.

For ages 3-7.

26826.name: The Games of GODZ
26826.description:
Subtitled "The Chameleon of Games", this is a game system for playing any of the 11 different games for which rules are supplied. Introduction text:

"The Games of GODZ is a unique and highly versatile game tool rather than a game in itself... the board is interpreted or subdivided in four different ways to allow the employment of different mathematical systems. Virtually all strategy game sin existence employ some method of mathematical logic thereby making it apparent "the Games of GODZ" is capable of utilizing many systems as the basis for a vast number of games.

The blocks are generally considered to be people and are therefore colored according to the four major races of the world. A block has an opening in one of its faces. This is used to indicate masculinity or femininity, depending on how it is placed on the board."

General rules explain different moves (where units move a number of squares equal to their value), "trick moves" (where units combine, merge, split, switch or piggyback), takes (capturing or converting the enemy), etc.. Specific rules tell which areas of the board are in play and what moves or takes are allowed. A deck of cards is used with some of the games.

Some games are mainly "movement" games, where the players have to move pieces into enemy or objective spaces, while others are "capture" games, where player have to kill all or specific enemy pieces. An interesting game in the set is "Cry", specifically for three players. One player plays with two other players, who are playing a different game, to score points by thwarting captures by either player - in effect, becoming a peacekeeper.

Game components:

- one board of 144 squares, divided into many colors and associations.
- 124 plastic blocks: 4 sets of 31 blocks each in red, white, yellow and black. Each set is made up of 16 "ones" (blocks are 1 cubic unit or 1x1x1), 8 "twos" (1x1x2), 4 "fours" (2x2x1), 2 "eights" (2x2x2) and 1 "sixteen" (2x2x4).
144 playing cards: 4 sets of 36 cards each marked in the same colors as the blocks (but not actually so colored) and with an associated letter (G for Brown, O for Red, D for White, and Z for Yellow). Cards are present in the same numbers as with the blocks, with five spares added to make 36 in a set.
- one booklet of 14 pages of general rules and specific rules, as well as rules on how to play Chess and Checkers with the game set.
- one sheet of directions on how to set up the first of the 11 games.

26827.name: The Tower of Balance
26827.description:
This is a short dexterity game, played with a half-globe and six different pieces (cubes and cylinders) in six different colors. The game is about building a tower from the colored pieces on top of the half globe, which forms a wobbly surface.

Each turn, a player rolls the die to see which piece he has to stack onto the tower. The player who makes the tower collapse, loses the game.

26828.name: The Gamers Constellation
26828.description:
At the beginning of the game only the "Moon" tile is on the "night sky" board, and players will progressively add "Stars" tiles to the board. There are 3 different kind of Stars (4, 5 or 6 branches).

Each player has his own secret goal telling the shape of the Constellation he must realize on the board. To be valid, a Constellation must be made of only 1 type of Stars, and must include the Moon tile.

The winner is the first player who has his own Constellation appears on the board.

The Gamers Constellation uses the same game mechanics as Xochintlan and 6x5.

This game is available for free download on the author's website.

Note from the author: After having inserted this game in the BGG database, I realized there's another game named Constellation, from Hans van Halteren and published in 2003. The two games look very similar in many aspects... This is only pure coincidence !
Mine is derived from the original "Fountain of the King" that I originally designed in 1995, which transformed into Xochintlan, then 6x5, and now the Gamers Constellation. I thought this was a great and original idea ... well, my bad !

26829.description:
Adventures in the Dungeon is a small Dungeon-Crawler originally published within "The Official Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Coloring Album." The game's rules are cleverly placed at the bottom of each page, and are complimented by a map of the Dungeon in the center of the book.

The game is designed for 1-4 players, who will assume the role of characters seeking The Holy Talisman of St. Cuthbert. The 4 characters (Paladin, Rangeress, Fighter, Wizard) each have different abilities.

To find the Talisman, players must wander the Dungeon and face the creatures therein. Combat is simulated with 2D6, and the players roll attacks for both themselves and their monstrous opponents. The various monsters have special abilities, and the characters will need to coordinate their efforts carefully to make it through.

Players win the Quest by finding the Talisman, and a scoring system is included based on how many monsters were slain, and how many characters survive.
26829.name: Adventures in the Dungeon

26830.name: Coca-Cola Mini-Fußball
26830.description:
Two player soccer game, comes packed in what looks like a Coca Cola can.. Each player has one plastic field player and tries to score goals. The first player to reach 10 points, wins.

Contents:
2 plastic soccer players
2 balls
1 soccer pitch (green mat with markings)
rules

26831.name: Hustled History
26831.description: This is a party game where the players are telling a story and adding 'mystery' words. It is, according to the directions, "A Laughable Round Party Game". It contains instructions and about 100 cards used during the storytelling of the game.

26832.name: Six by Six
26832.description: Six by Six is a game system from Kadon with a wooden board and four unique sets of pieces. The game has replaced Leap, an earlier Kadon game, but also is now greatly expandable to include several other games as included. These include maze games, maze solitaires, math gambits, and x-in-row designs. A very nice upgrade and nice new system for intriguing abstracts.

26833.name: Take a Number
26833.description: Take a Number is a game by Stephen Sniderman created for Kadon Games' 25th anniversary. It is actually 25 games in one, each nicely outlines in a thick rulebook. The rulebook also includes multiple solitaire games and math puzzles. This game is available on its own or is playable with Kadon's Six-by-Six game set.

26834.name: Boston T-Party
26834.description: Boston T-Party is a limited edition game (only 100 made) and puzzle set from Kadon. The set includes 11 polyforms in unique shapes and three different colors. These can make four different t-shaped puzzles and numerous other figures. Like most Kadon polyform sets, the included guidebook includes many alternatives for use and game play.

26835.name: Grunt 3rd Edition: Fantasy Miniature Battles
26835.description:
First printed in 1996, in the years since Grunt has sold thousands and thousands of copies over four print versions (Original 1st edition, 2nd Edition, 2nd Edition: Deluxe and 2nd Edition: Deluxe 2 player Box Set). Now newly updated to Grunt 3rd Edition, this revised edition of Grunt has brought the game system back to its roots, a fast paced, easy to learn all purpose fantasy miniatures system thats extremely affordable.

Grunt is a unique miniatures system that focusses on army development, where you may recruit new units through the course of game play, plus have existing units gain experience points and levels. With expansion sets you can expand your army building options to include skills, abilities, expand your kingdom, customize your castles, add wizardry, monsters, magical items, develop heroes and immortals and more.


In this fashion, you strive to build up your army and kingdom over multiple battles (game sessions). You must weigh the costs to your army to achieve victory in your battle today against the gains victory can gain for your army for the long haul.
Grunt 3rd Edition is a complete miniatures game system, including game rules, 45 Battle Cards, a castle template, city template, assorted cut-out Battlefield Markers, plus cut-out army units enough to field two complete armies. And, of course, you can always print out more as needed!.

Includes:
Cover + 38 pages
- Game Rules
- 45 Battle Cards
- Castle Template
- City template
- 2 Cut-Out Armies
- Assorted Battlefield Markers that include Supply, Traps, Cavalry, Fortifications, Fortresses, Scaling Ropes, Ballisti, Siege Towers, Castle Defenses, and Catapults.

26836.description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
Règle complète pour le jeu avec figurines de 6 à 25 mm, pour la période 1792-1815. De Bonaparte à Napoléon — ou DBN — s’est affirmée comme la nouvelle règle de référence sur cette période épique. La première édition, rapidement épuisée, se trouve à présent remaniée et améliorée grâce à l’expérience des très nombreux joueurs pratiquant DBN. Cette seconde édition, désormais indispensable à tous, comprend les règles complètes amendées et des marqueurs sur planche cartonnée à découper.


(BGG user translation and description:)

In English:
Complete rules for 6 to 25mm miniatures games, 1792-1815 period. De Bonaparte à Napoléon — or DBN — has now became the new reference rule on this epic period. The first edition, quickly sold out, is now revised and improved thanks to the experience of many players practicing DBN. This second edition now indispensable to all, includes the complete rules amended and markers on cardboard sheets.


These rules are based in the DBX system (DBM, DBA, DBR, HOTT) but applied for the Revolutionary and the Napoleonic Wars into army corps level. They cover the maneuvres, formations and combat of the period in a way which would be very familiar to those players of the before mentioned games.

IN FRENCH ONLY.
26836.name: De Bonaparte à Napoléon

26837.name: Monaro City Racing Game
26837.description: Make your way around the chosen race route and be the first player to reach the checkered flag. Watch your fuel, beware of nasty weather conditions, manage pitstops, and avoid detours in your pursuit of glory.

26838.name: Straightaway
26838.description: Players race die-cast 5 laps around an oval track. A standard D6 is used to determine for far your car moves. The game includes marbles that are used to mark off the lap count of the lead car.

26839.name: Piecepack Letterbox
26839.description:
This game is based on the real-life outdoor sport of letterboxing.

Players hide "letterboxes" somewhere on the board and write clues for the other players. Everyone then attempts to find as many letterboxes as possible. A player gains victory points both when she finds other letterboxes and when other players find hers.

The game ends when one player has found all other letterboxes. The player with the most victory points is then the winner.

This game won the first Mesomorph Games Piecepack Competition in 2006, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the four seasons expansion.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

26840.description:
From the game:

Vrrrm, the racing cars set off at full throttle! Due to oil stains they risk skidding. Who, by bluffing, good tactics and a bit of luck, will cross the target line first? A zippy circuit competition for 2-5 racing drivers. With warm-up variation for younger players.

Appropriate for ages 6 and up.

Habermaaß / HABA Game# 4492

Other titles: Full Speed Ahead!, Go 0 to 100, A toute vitesse, Van 0 tot 100.

Rules available in German, English, French, Dutch.
26840.name: Von 0 auf 100

26841.name: Table-MotoGP: The Moto GP Licensed Board Game
26841.description:
From The Rule Book:

"Welcome to the exciting and thrilling world of MotoGP racing.
Start enjoying right now the magic, the strategy and the tactics – just like your idols do – of competing in appealing circuits such as TT Assen, emblematic ones such as the Circuit de Catalunya and fast ones such as Donington Park.
Compete with a total of 11 teams and 19 drivers from 8 countries.
Compete with 5 world class manufacturers who will use their best efforts and technology to help you win.
The ultimate goal of this game is naturally to win individual races if you play in Single Race mode, or to win the MotoGP Championship if you play in Championship mode.
To do this, you will have to prove your strategy, your luck and your skill, until the checkered flag comes down and you’ve won – just like in real races.
Each race consists of a total of 3 laps. Depending on the number of players, this will take you between 1.5 and 2 hours."

Each game contains:

19 Bikes in 8 two-driver teams and 3 single-driver teams
3 Grandstands with spectators
1 Pit building
4 dice
1 Pad of Sheets for recording race results.
1 Pad of Sheets for recording championship placings.
6 Boards of the following tracks:
Circuit de Catalunya (Spain)
TT Assen (Netherlands)
Mugello (Italy)
Donington Park (Great Britain)
Le Mans (France)
Twin Ring Motegui (Japan)

1 Instruction book




Home Page: http://gamesfortableraces.com/ >>> edit: 2013 Novemver 18th - web site is not in use anymore <<<

26842.name: Hunt and Seek Worldwide
26842.description:
The game contains 4 double sided boards, with a detailed image of an exotic location from around the world printed on each side. There is also a set of cards displaying objects that can be found on every board. The objects are hidden within the images so that they mingle with the background, making them hard to spot.

At the beginning of the game, a single board is selected. On each turn, a card is turned face up and players try to spot the object as fast as possible. The first one to do so wins the card. The winner is the player who accumulated the most cards.

26843.name: The Search For The Graf Spee
26843.description:
From the publisher's catalog: "Once again the German pocket-battleship is loose in the South Atlantic and the British player faces the challenge of finding and bringing her to battle. Graf Spee comes complete with die-cut counters, rules booklet, battle board and two movement boards."

Another entry in the long line of AH Bismarck-style search and battle naval wargames, this one is very rare. As the name implies, it covers the search for the German "pocket battleship" Graf Spee in 1939.

With the usual low-quality Third Millenia components (especially the counters) and very simple rules, it is nevertheless a pretty fun game.

Like AH Bismarck, Midway, et al, movement and search are conducted on the two identical map sheets, and battles are resolved on the battle and charts sheet. Turn order is:
a. German player rolls for bad weather (no searches). German player moves.
b. British player searches.
c. British player moves.
d. German player searches.
e. If both in same hex, resolve battle.
f. When all battles are resolved, advance the turn record and start over.

The British can search the hexes ships are in, and one more hex within four hexes (search aircraft). Aircraft carriers (4 British and 1 French) can search the six adjacent hexes. The German player can search the hexes ships are in, plus the Graf Spee has two search aircraft that can search within four hexes. The German player can also search any other three hexes on the board (u-boat reports?).

Both players must keep track of fuel expenditures, and both have supply ships available to re-fuel (or they can re-fuel in ports). Every other turn the German player can roll on a table to sink one (or two) merchantmen. If he sinks any, he then rolls on another table to see how many turns later he must inform the British player in which hex the sinking occurred. The German player must sink a number of merchant ships and escape the map to win; otherwise the British player wins.

No indication is given of map or time scale. I suspect search board turns are one day. 20 turns to a game.

Components: two identical 14" x 24" hex-gridded search map sheets, one 14" x 24" battle and chart sheet, one rule folder (five small pages), plus 119 of 1/2-inch die-cut unit counters.
I think there were 24 actual ship counters, some "?" s and "search" counters, and a bunch of blanks (my copy is unfortunately incomplete).

26844.description: Once Upon a Time: Create-Your-Own Storytelling Cards contains blank cards – both "story" and "ending" cards – that can be customized and added to Once Upon a Time. The first edition of OUaT:CYOSC (for the second edition of OUaT) contains 56 blank cards (40 "story" and 16 "ending"), while the second edition of OUaT:CYOSC (for the third edition of OUaT, with new border artwork matching Omar Rayyan's artwork) contains 55 blank cards (38 "story" and 17 "ending").
boardgameaccessory: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
26844.name: Once Upon a Time: Create-Your-Own Storytelling Cards

26845.name: Zatrikion
26845.description:
Byzantium is the name given to both the state and the culture of the Hellenic Empire in the middle ages. Both the state and the inhabitants always called themselves Hellenes/Roman, as did most of their neighbors. Western Europeans, who had their own Roman Empire called them Orientals or Greeks (Hellenes). Byzantion was the ancient name of the capital city and Byzantines after the former name of the Empire's capital city, Constantinople.

Zatrikion is the game of Byzantine chess. This chess has seven variations according to the more ancient board game of "Pessoi".

These versions have all the known pawns of the modern chess ("Mad Queen" was the first name) and in some variations there are many other pawns connecting to the philosophy of the Byzantine era.

Played with Byzantine Greek era letters for 2 players as the modern chess.
In some versions are three dices with the ancient shapes of Byzantium era and in this version the highest roll starts the game.

Zatrikion has the following items:
1. Seven colorful Boards (Grids).
2. The pawns of each player with different color. In Byzantium era the colors was the veneti (red color) and the greens (green color). These were the political parties in Byzantium era.
3. Three dices with shapes.
4. Other material.
5. A book with some information for this game along with photos from the Byzantine era.

This board game will be soon in a new version.

26846.name: Dungeonation
26846.description:
Self-published Heroquest-like game.

This whole game is being redesigned from the ground up (2015).

26847.name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº1 – Vive la Nation, 1792-1802
26847.description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
Compléments indispensables à la règle De Bonaparte à Napoléon, les trois livrets de Listes d'armées (au format standard 18 x 24 cm) présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce livret présente les armées des belligérants de la période révolutionnaire.


(BGG user translation and description:)

In English:
Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This booklet presents the armies of the belligerents during the [French] revolutionary period.

Included are the royalists armies and the coalition armies which fought against France in the stated period. The last pages are dedicated to errata of army books 2 and 3. The system used here is similar to those of the army books for the DBx system of play.

IN FRENCH ONLY.

26848.name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº2 – Les Annes de Gloire, 1805-1811
26848.description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:

Compléments indispensables à la règle de jeux De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN), les trois livrets de Listes d'armées présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce second livret est consacré au début de l'Empire, de 1805 à 1811.


(BGG user translation:)

In English:

Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This second booklet is devoted to the beginning of the [French] Empire, from 1805 to 1811.

IN FRENCH ONLY.

26849.name: Listes d'armées pour De Bonaparte à Napoléon: Livret nº3 – Les Annes Terribles, 1812-1815
26849.description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:

Compléments indispensables à la règle de jeu De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN), les trois livrets de Listes d'armées présentent, sous forme de budget, la composition détaillée d'armées-type à destination des joueurs de DBN. Ce troisième volet clot la série avec les années sombres de l'Empire, de 1812 à 1815.


(BGG user translation:)

In English:

Essential supplements to the De Bonaparte à Napoléon (DBN) rule, the three Army lists booklets present, in form of budget, detailed typical armies for DBN players. This third part ends the series with the [French] Empire's dark years, from 1812 to 1815.

IN FRENCH ONLY.

26850.name: Ring A-Round Mix and Match Word Game
26850.description: Turn the rings to mix and match letters and pictures. The player who makes the most words wins. Unique double sided game board offers multiple levels of challenge.

26852.name: Hi-Ho! Color Go-Round
26852.description: It's learning fun the Golden way as children match color dominoes along a spiraling color path. Color recognition and matching skills are reinforced. For ages 3 and up.

26853.name: Spell-A-Puzzle
26853.description: Shuffle all the tiles and give 5 to each player. Place all the remaining tiles in the center face down. Players race to find letters that match their words and the player who finishes all of their words first is the winner. For ages 4 and up.

26854.description:
Tactic Blue is a compilation of 6 abstract games by 3 different authors. All of the games are played on a two-sided board, using the hex-grid or square-grid side.


Accasta
Abande
Attangle
Attraktion
Alva
International Checkers


Accasta, Abande, Attangle are games designed by Dieter Stein and are part of his stacking games trilogy. Attraktion, a game by Jaroslav Cichocki, uses pull force (attraction) in movement to form a winning condition. Alva, designed by Alvydas Jakeliunas, is like a souped-up version of checkers. The last game included is a classic International Checkers. Apparently the gameboard and components happened to be compatible. Some of the games were previously published on websites.
26854.name: Tactic Blue

26855.description:
Miniature wargame science fiction skirmish rules.

5150: What is it? - Extract from the rules:
5150 is a game of sci-fi skirmish warfare. The rules handle fast and furious firefights set in the far future. If all you want to do is play “one up” unrelated battles on the tabletop you can do just that. But if you want, 5150 can be more than just a wargame.

5150 thrusts you into a universe populated by both humans and aliens. Real aliens. Not just characters with a number changed here or there to make them "tougher" but real aliens that act differently.

5150 starts you off in the middle of the action. Choose whom you are and what you want to do. Star Army soldier commanding a military formation sound good? Maybe a mercenary making ends meet by salvaging equipment on far off planets? How about an adventurer, coming and going as you please always in search of that one big "find" that’ll make you famous? Heck, you can even be a blue-skinned alien if you choose! With 5150 you’re only limited by your imagination. If you can imagine it you can do it.

5150 provides a changing universe to campaign in. Not only your actions but also the actions of those beyond your control help shape your life. But like in real life first you must survive before you thrive as you try to establish yourself and your followers as a force to be reckoned with. Gain experience and skills as you successfully move through the galaxy. Find friends; make enemies, its all there in 5150. As time passes challenges change and it will take a combination of tactics and strategy to succeed. And a little luck won’t hurt either!

If you’ve played Chain Reaction 2.0, All Things Zombie, or Nuts! to name a few the mechanics in 5150 will be familiar but if you haven’t don’t worry. 5150 is a stand-alone game, easy to learn and fun to play.
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures Episode 19

26856.name: MonkeyWinks
26856.description:
From the Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Once again, the geniuses at Three Monkey Games have turned a classic game on its ear and came up with something BRAND NEW! Introducing MonkeyWinks! The popular indoor game that is easy to learn for kids, and formidable enough to appeal to adults wanting a special challenge.

Like its predecessor, MonkeyWinks is a game played with sets of small, thin discs (called winks) lying on a special felt mat. Players use a larger disc (called a squidger) to pop a smaller disc into flight by pressing down on one side of the smaller disc. The basic goal of an informal game (easily playable by young children) is to cause the smaller discs to land inside a pot or cup. The formal game has a more robust set of rules, goals, and strategies suitable to serious competition for adults and older children.

MonkeyWinks is interactive fun for all players, pros and beginners alike. However, MonkeyWinks is a lot more than just a flipping disc game. For example, the included "Go Bananas"™ cards incorporate random events and player changes inspired by everyday kids games.
www.monkeypoker1.com

26857.name: Monkey Poker
26857.description:
From Three Monkey Games website:www.monkeypoker1.com

Looking for a fun, new indoor game idea for children, and kids of all ages? Learn Poker along with Berry "The Bluffer" Bananahammock, "Fearless" Freddy Funkymunky, Albert "All In" Alexander and Mr. Bill "Bananas" Dole as they play this new and fun variation on the most popular card game in recent years: Texas Hold 'Em!

WHY MONKEY AROUND WITH A GOOD THING?!

MONKEY POKER™ takes the easy to learn card game Texas Hold 'em, and adds the entertaining randomness of such classic children's games as Monopoly™ and The Game of Life™. It's a great game idea for your next kid's party or sleepover!

The winner of each poker hand has to take a "Go Bananas!" card from a deck, and then do what the card says for bonus chi(m)ps! The tasks range from the silly ("Take $1000 in Chimps from everyone, except for the person with the hairiest feet!") to the sublime ("Switch seats with the person to your left. Now have the other monkeys do the same.").
The Chimps awarded by the "Go Bananas cards" can go either way, either to the winner or another player, so everyone has an equal chance of winning!

Plus with additional ways to win, MONKEY POKER™ is a hilariously fun card game with "a peel" for all ages! We guarantee you'll like it a bunch! www.monkeypoker1.com

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
26859.description:
From the website of the publisher:

Oh clever goblins, will you be able to avoid the wrath of the Dark Lord (Rigor Mortis, the Master of all Evils) while he wanders in his study? Terrible spells will be cast upon those who are hit by the glances of the Dark Lord!

Kragmortha is a party game for 2-8 players that will be afflicted by exhilarating penances. No one will resist its humor!

BEWARE! This game produces physical penances and is nocive (definition of nocive is : Hurtful or injurious) to the health!

Kragmortha shares artwork with Aye, Dark Overlord! The Red Box
26859.name: Kragmortha

26860.name: Atlantaopoly
26860.description:
Atlantaopoly is a game concerned with business trade in Atlanta. The object of the game is to accumulate as much wealth as possible through the purchase, trade, and development of businesses.

Board game spaces include Turner Broadcasting System, Friends of Zoo Atlanta, Atlanta History Center, The Carter Presidential Center, and Georgia-Pacific.

Players may improve their businesses by building high-rises (two, three, four, and five-story buildings) and eventually sky scapers.

26861.name: You Gotta Be Kidding! The Crazy Game of "Would You Rather...?"
26861.description: Children's version of the Zobmondo!! games (ages 7 and up). On your turn, you roll a die and move your pawn that many spaces. Pick up a "Would You Rather" card and select which of the two choices you would rather do (such as "Would you rather: 1) Run across a hungry alligator's back; or 2) Run under an angry elephant?"). Your opponents decide which they'd think you'd do as well, and record it by putting a token under their palm with either the "Choice 1" or "Choice 2" side facing up. Then you announce your choice, explain your choice, and try to guess which choice your opponents thought that you would make. Each time you guess correctly, you move your pawn one space on the board. The game ends when someone crosses the finish line.

26862.description:
This book includes 63 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules. Most of them are from the Middle-East and eastern Mediterranean.
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
26862.name: DBM Army Lists Book 1: 3000 BC to 500 BC

26863.description:
This book includes 84 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules.
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
26863.name: DBM Army Lists Book 2: 500 BC to 476 AD

26864.description:
This book includes 79 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules.
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
26864.name: DBM Army Lists Book 3: 476 AD to 1071 AD

26865.description:
This book includes 84 armies from all around the world to use with the DBM rules for the late middle-age to early renaissance.
Each list is designed to produce 300 AP to 500 AP armies which closely simulate their real life prototype, while still allowing sufficient flexibility to cover historical variations during the period and legitimate differences of opinion or personal preference.
26865.name: DBM Army Lists Book 4: 1071 AD to 1500 AD

26867.name: Harry Potter Championship Quidditch
26867.description:
In Harry Potter Championship Quidditch players take on the role of either Harry Potter or Draco Malfoy in a high-energy 1-on-1 version of author J.K. Rowling's magical sport.
Each player must fire small red balls - quaffles - through rotating hoops in the center of the playing field. Each successful shot is worth ten points, but also more often than not gives the quaffle to your opponent. With eight quaffles flying back and forth, though, there's plenty to go around!
At a random point in the contest, the game will launch a gold ping-pong-esque ball - the Golden Snitch - into the air. Whichever player catches the ball is awarded 150 points, and the game ends.
The game, which runs on two C batteries, provides sound effects during the game and also keeps track of the score, which can get into the thousands.

26868.name: I Love v. Ribbeck
26868.description:
"I game based on the ballad by Theodor Fontane. The garden is set up and the pears are distributed, depending on the number of players pears are put onto the tree, always at one side, or a player hands on pears to be put up. Pears must be taken with one Hand and always from the same side and be put onto a branch of the three. Depending on the variant one harvests pears that fall from the unused side and may keep them or give them away. The player with the most valuable pears after a preset number of rounds wins the game. Ballad printed in the rules.

Dexterity and tactical game * 2 or more players * no age given * Designer: Reinhold Wittig * Graphics: Karin und Reinhold Wittig * Edition Perlhuhn, Germany, 2005 *** Edition Perlhuhn * www.perlhuhn.de * webmaster@perlhuhn.de"

From www.spielen.at 2006/11/31

26869.description:
