Finally the night has arrived! All the little witches can fly to witch mountain and participate in the big dance. However you have to watch out for the little thunder witch, because her broom is a bit slow and her wand keeps shooting thunder by accident.

There's a track of 7 spaces between the witch house and the mountain. You have five face down cards, with symbols on them in front of you.

On your turn you roll the die. If you get one of the five symbols, you get to flip over one card from each opponent. If you find a matching symbol, you get to advance a space towards the mountain. Then everyone flips their card back over. If you roll the ThUndER (BUMP bump Bahhhh...) Witch symbol you move your left most card to the right. (BUMP bump Bahhhh...) :D
26869.name: Little Thunder Witch

26870.name: ElectraWoman & DynaGirl Game
26870.description:
ElectraWoman & DynaGirl must reach the Secret Scientific Formula space in their ElectraCar and return to ElectraBase while using different combinations of Computer Power symbol cards to thwart the bad guys: The Sorcerer, The Pharaoh, The Empress of Evil, The Spider Lady, Glitter Rock, and Ali Baba.

Each Trouble Space depicts a different combination of Computer Power symbols needed in order to overcome it. Computer Powers include ElectraData, ElectraForce, ElectraBeam, and a few Super Power cards (a combination of all three). If a player does not have the right combination of Computer Powers for that particular Trouble Space, they must remain in it until the correct combination is achieved. A card is drawn every turn, regardless of whether a player can move.

Additional cards used to obstruct opposing players include ElectraPush and ElectraComp Blocked.

This game is based on the short-lived Sid and Marty Krofft live action children’s television series from 1976, starring Deidre Hall in her first major television role as ElectraWoman and Judy Strangis as DynaGirl.

26871.name: Newshound
26871.description:
Players seek to answer trivia regarding famous news stories dating back as early as 1900. Categories include: 20th Century, 21st Century, Sports, Arts & Entertainment, and Science & Technology.

Victory is achieved by scoring five of one category, a 3/2 combination, or a run including each category, so players are awarded both for breadth of knowledge as well as expertise.

Of particular interest to trivia buffs is that each question, when answered, includes the story behind the headline.

"The game of strategy, fun, and fascinating facts."

www.newshoundgame.com

26872.name: The Vicksburg Campaign
26872.description:
April 1863
Union General Ulysses S. Grant embarks on another attempt to wrest control of the last major Confederate stronghold on the Mississippi River from the rebels; the fortress city of Vicksburg. Numerous other attempts have failed miserably. The ill-fated campaign from the north, short circuited by that devil Forrest's raid on Grant's supply lines. The jinxed canal, dug through the swamps in an attempt to bypass the city's guns. Now another plan is in motion. Grant will march his Army of the Tennessee through the Louisiana swamps, sneak his ships past the rebel fortress in a daring run of the gauntlet, conduct the largest amphibious invasion in U.S. history, separate himself from his supply base, wedge himself in between two rebel armies, and seize control of the city from the east! All the while battling politicians and public opinion as much as the Confederate armies. Somehow, his daring plan worked, and the Mississippi once again flowed unvexed to the sea.

But things could have been different. Find out how....

This operational level game uses the block unit system to re-create the limited intelligence of the actual campaign. Players maneuver their forces without adequate knowledge of their opponents strengths or even location. The game board spans the campaign topography, from the swamps of eastern Louisiana to the mountainous terrain around Jackson Mississippi. A point to point movement system is employed on a 20 x 24 playing map. Limited command abilities and critical supply wagons are key to managing your armies and achieving victory.

26873.name: Kruzno
26873.description:
Kruzno is an abstract strategy game usually played with two players on a hexagonally tiled board. Though the rules are extremely simple (three minutes to learn for most players), the number of possible moves and interactions are comparable to chess.

Kruzno uses standard chess pieces (bishops, knights and rooks) but is more closely related to hexagonal checkers and R.C. Bell's Jungle Game. Like the Jungle Game, capturing is non-transitive: bishops capture knights; knights capture rooks; rooks capture bishops. This split between offense and defense means that most standard strategies of move and capture have to be scrapped or reworked.

Game variants include versions with reduced number of pieces for faster play and expansion sets for three players.

Home Page: http://www.kruzno.com/

26874.name: Peepul Pals
26874.description: Card driven movement game for children. Based on the "Peepul Pals" line of books and dolls published by Whitman in the 1960's

26875.name: Blow Your Cool
26875.description:
Played on a large (approx 4 foot x 4 foot) vinyl mat. Players try to blow plastic balls across another player's "loser line". You must try to prevent other player's ball from crossing your line or you earn 1 loser card. Be careful if you touch your ball you earn 2 loser cards.

The game ends when the 45 loser cards are given out. The player with the fewest cards wins.

26876.name: Gay Purr-ee Game
26876.description: Spin and move children's game. Featuring the cats Jean-Tom and Mewsette traveling through Paris.

26877.name: Fun Fair Game
26877.description: Players race around the State Fair ground stopping at attractions to collect prizes. Be the first player to collect 6 different prizes and you win.

26878.name: Regatta
26878.description: Spin and Move boat racing game.

26879.name: Gulf War
26879.description:
Gulf War is a Malaysian board game from 1990, using as its theme the then ongoing war in the Persian gulf. Its game mechanism is borrowed from An Qi (literally dark chess, because pieces are covered at the start and so unknown to the players: it is a game played using Xiangqi pieces). Each side has a number of pieces ranking from President down to Hostages or Civilians, and also Bombs, Fighter Planes and Oil-fields. Like An Qi (and for that matter games like LuZhanJunQi and Stratego), the pieces have a ranked order and higher ranked pieces eliminate lower ranked ones. Pieces start face-down and are randomly distributed in alternate colors on the 6X6 square grid that is the game board. Players take turn to expose pieces and once exposed, pieces may be moved one space orthogonally. Enemy pieces are eliminated by a higher or equal ranked piece moving on to them. There are special rules for specific pieces - the Assassin may eliminate the President, Bombs neutralize (i.e. both pieces get eliminated) all other pieces, capturing an Oil-field/Hostages/Civilians piece allows substitution of your own piece for a previously eliminated piece, etc. The Fighter Plane has the capture of the Pao (Cannon) in An Qi - just like in Xiangqi, it jumps over another piece to land on a distal piece and capture it.
The game is won by the player who is able to capture both the opposing President and Vice-president.

The game has interesting details - one player takes the Iraqi side and the other is the Allied side. The President, Vice-president and Ally pieces are different and have pictures appropriate to the side (Saddam, Bush, Gaddfi and Thatcher all feature). Another difference is that the Iraqis have a Civilians piece but the Allied forces has a Hostages piece instead (in the game, they are equivalent). The board comes with two sides - one side has yellow and blue circles to show where the pieces go. The other has the same 6X6 grid superimposed on a background map showing the Persian gulf.

26880.name: Bozo the Clown Circus Game
26880.description:
Spin and move children's game. Based on the TV show Bozo the Clown. The board shows Bozo in the Circus,under the big top.

Climb the ladder, go across the high wire, if you fall there is a safety net, as you race to the finish line.

26881.name: World Tank Campaigns: Bulge
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge
26881.description:
World Tank Campaigns (WTC) is a series of tactical games that employ cards, miniatures, and boards in a fast-playing action game designed primarly for solitaire, with one-on-one action as well. WTC is the brainchild of Dana Lombardy, designer of the award winning Streets of Stalingrad.

The game is card driven with dice used for combat and special actions. Combat is represented on a tactical to operational level.

World Tank Campaigns: Bulge: Germany’s last gamble in the Ardennes to change the course of the war initially surprised the American forces, but it resulted in a major Allied victory. Each player play the role of a German or American tank commander directing a platoon of tanks with supporting forces. The game plays out on a Battle Board unique to the scenario and tanks used in that scenario.

The World Tank Campaigns: Bulge Set has everything needed to play SOLITAIRE and 2-PLAYER games:


2 historically accurate, incredibly detailed 1/144 scale plastic tanks
Miniature tanks are pre-painted and fully assembled and include a historical information sheet about each tank
2 full-color battle “boards” unique to the Ardennes and the Sherman M4A3 and Panther G tanks
6 custom designed army-specic dice, plus standard d6 & d10
88 full-color playing cards make gameplay fast and exciting
55 die-cut play aid tokens (not show here), illustrated rulebook, and Quick Start Rules for the solitaire game


2 EXPANSION Sets include:


22 additional cards, a Jagdpanzer IV tank-killer or King Tiger super heavy tank with their own unique battle boards and scenarios.


Home Page of the Game: http://www.world-tank-campaigns.com/
Home Page for the Miniatures: http://www.world-tank-museum.com/

26882.name: Yogi Bear: Go Fly a Kite Game
26882.description: Spin and Move Children's game. Game Board featuring the animated characters of Yogi Bear, Boo-Boo Bear, Mr. Ranger, Quickdraw McGraw, Huckleberry Hound and others Flying kites.

26883.name: Arrest and Trial
26883.description:
Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "Arrest and Trial" starring Ben Gazzara and Chuck Conners.

Move around the city collecting clues and questioning witnesses.

It is the same board and mechanics as "Dragnet".

boardgamehonor: 2007 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
26884.description:
Players in Escalation! want to collect as few cards as possible. Each player starts with a hand of six cards from a deck that contains cards numbered 1-13, three jokers that can be worth 1-7, and two "pass" cards. One player opens by playing a single card or multiple cards with the same value, then calls out the sum of the cards played. The next player — and each player after that — must play cards to surpass that sum or else collect all of the cards played so far, after which they open with one or more cards. As soon as one player is out of cards, everyone else adds their cards in hand to the cards that they've collected and tallies their score.

After playing as many rounds as the number of players at the table, whoever has the lowest score wins!
26884.name: Escalation!
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 32 - Knizia on Ingenious Puzzles, plus Dragon Parade, Escalation and Mmm...Brains

26885.name: Dino the Dinosaur Game
26885.description: Spin and Move children's game based on the animated TV show "The Flintstones".

26886.name: The Detectives
26886.description: Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "The Detectives" starring Robert Taylor. Players race around the board collecting clue's. A spinner determines the location of the various clues.

26887.name: The Big Payoff
26887.description: A football board game that is designed to be played while watching actual games on TV. Players place bets on the board indicating what play they think the offensive or defensive will make in the actual game.

26888.name: Hand 2 Hand
26888.description:
In Hand 2 Hand, players take turns drawing various things while other players attempt to guess what's being drawn. Points are scored for correct guesses.

The trick is that partners must use the "double-handed drawing arm", working together to properly draw each subject.

26889.name: Money Maker
26889.description: Money Maker, A game of free enterprise. Is a very monopoly like game that is used to market local businesses. It consists of a gameboard, 2 dice, 4 pawns, a rules booklet, money in four denominations, a pad of Business Ownership and Expansion Record sheets, and a set of risk cards. Rather than using houses and such to show ownership and improvement (as monopoly does) Branches are noted on the sheets. On the gameboard all of the businesses are representations of local businesses.

26890.description:
Wormhole by Worldworks Games is a tabletop space combat game which promises an affordable yet paradigm shifting gaming experience. Taking the "virtual board game" concept to the bleeding edge; instead of forcing overpriced lead miniatures on players Wormhole offers a complete fleet of high quality 3-D models that you print and build from your home printer. This feature alone gives players the opportunity to build massive fleets without breaking the bank.

Wormhole promises "cinematic" space combat with visual style and presentation not yet seen in the genre. Rules are easy to understand but offer a scaling level of depth for a variety of play styles. Wormhole also introduces an interactive damage and orders system which removes heavy book-keeping tasks and replaces it with a "control panel-like" interface (you feel absolutely in control, barking orders to your fleet). A number of unique gaming elements conspire to make Wormhole a truly immersive and completely original gaming experience.

Home Page: http://www.worldworksgames.com/wormhole.html
26890.name: Wormhole

26891.name: Firepower Pass
26891.description: Designed to easily control 15-20 capital ships a side (which can be 4-5 squadrons), while concentrating on squadron level tactics, Firepower Pass uses a unique command oriented system that allows units to attack as individual ships (i.e. at a tactical level) yet defend and maneuver in 3D as squadrons. Octagonal 3D movement tiles easily and elegantly depict the 2D vector of 3D movement.

26892.name: The AlphaPets Game
26892.description: This is a memory game where each player is trying to find and build the alphabet made of puzzle pieces of their chosen color.

26893.name: Go Diego Go!  Rescue the baby dinosaur
26893.description:
A themed Chutes & Ladders variant with some additions, like Rescue Pack squares that allow an extra roll, hang glider squares that allow (and force) the player to switch positions with someone else. The board now goes to 91 and there's a dinosaur track on top.

Alternate cooperative rules are included with some interesting additional developments.

Includes board, rules, 6 pawns, 1 die, rubber dinosaur.

26894.name: Horse of the Year
26894.description: Board game based on Horse Show Jumping. The game has four plastic horses with riders, a variety of fences, walls and other items to make up the Show Jumping course on the board.

26895.name: Hell & Uncivil Disorder
26895.description:
Hell & Uncivil Disorder is a set of miniature wargame rules for Brushfire Wars and "Magic" in the 20th Century (there is also a Science Fiction option because Jim Webster is "happily confident our descendants will be as incompetent as we are").
The rules are suitable for use with a variety of figure scales (including a 1/300 variant) with a ground scale of approximately 20 yards to the inch.
The rules are intended for conflicts where first world forces are fighting third world forces and hence treats technology as magic (as per the well know Arthur C Clarke quotation) but may be used for any modern conflict.

26896.name: Imperial Commander
26896.description:
Imperial Commander is a set of miniature wargame rules for science fiction combat. It was based around the Tabletop Figures range of 15mm Sci Fi figures and was designed to give a fast game when using around 50 figures per side.
The rules cover light infantry through to power armor, force shields and vehicles. They also contain some army lists and conversions from Laserburn and Combat 3000.

26897.name: Wichita Scene
26897.description:
Get ready to experience the Wichita Scene! Live and work at an exciting pace, make and break deals, buy and sell property, finance and liquidate businesses!

You'll get to establish proper connections with the planning director, influence the board of realtors, confront a Labor Leader and deal with the Downtown Revitalization Committee.

You may have thought Wichita doesn't have a scene... well, that may be true. But now, YOU can live the dream!

26898.name: Semantic
26898.description: A game very much in the vein of Trivial Pursuit. Semantic requires players to answer questions based on the meaning of words. Players must complete a path around the board answering questions as they go. Movement is based on a dice roll.

26899.name: Our Navy
26899.description:
This game from the Wing National Game Company of St. Augustine, FLA was indeed copyrighted in 1898.

[The box says this game was published by Parker Brothers.]

The game consists of a Battle Ground with 31 Navy Paths (31 circles) each of which are intersected at 5 or 6 places by other paths. These intersections are called fighting positions. Red, White and Blue designs across the battleground are called Line of Shot.

The game comes with 9 white and 9 black washers that represent Battleships from two Navies.

Each navy changes form (moves) in turn. Only one move is allowed at a time. The sinking of an opponents ship occurs when you manage to get two of your ships on the same line of shot as that of an enemy ship, with your nearest ship half way between the enemy and your back ship. When the range is so short that your two ships and the enemy lay in 3 consecutive positions then the enemy is captured and not sunk. When that happens you may remove the captured ship and place any of your ships in one of the starting positions. This allows you to fix placement errors by returning your ship to the start.

26900.name: Malin Baryard World Cup
26900.description:
Free translation from back of the box:

Do you dream about becoming a successful show jumping star just like Malin Baryard? In Malin’s own game WORLD CUP you get to test your talent in exciting jumping competitions. Initially you compete on a borrowed horse and try to collect enough prices to get all necessary equipment and a horse of your own. With that accomplished you just have to win one final competition to become the World Cup champion. All you need is luck, a bit of tactics and some horse knowledge.

Event cards and trivia questions make the game full of action and lots of fun. You also get to ride different horses and the better you perform the better horses you get to ride. Many of the available horses are "celebrities" and if you are really good you might even get to jump Butterfly Flip!

Good luck!

Malin Baryard

26901.name: König und Konsorten
26901.description:
It´s a little like the German game "Mau Maus".
There are four colors with five cards each. Also there are colored "law-cards"
You start with 12 coins and the game ends if one player has no more money at the end of a round. The player with the most money will win.
If it´s your turn you have to place a card on the start card. It has to match the color or the name of that card. If you can´t place a card you have to take a new one. If you can´t place it neither your turn ends.
The law-cards force other player to do silly things every turn or get a disadvantage during the round or at the end of it.
A few of the cards have instant effects on them.

box-inventory
82 cards
60 coins (gold and silver)
rules

26902.name: La llotja
26902.description:
After a very long night of fishing the boats replete with fish return to the port. In the Strap begins the auction of all the apprehensions, every player is interested in obtaining the highest price, and of all those more species better, spending the less amount of money.

A game of fishing auctions for from 3 to 6 players. It consists of 40 cards, 5 for each of the species and 90 coins.

26903.name: Mensch Natur Technik
26903.description:
A tactical dice-game for Hannover's places of interest, from Bothfield to Kirchrode.
"People Nature Technology" was the motto of the 2000 Hannover expo.


Ein taktisches Würfelspiel zu Hannoverschen Sehenswürdigkeiten von Bothfeld bis Kirchrode.
"Mensch Natur Technik" war das Motto der Expo 2000 in Hannover.

26904.name: Der Top Aktionär
26904.description:
In Top Aktionär (Top Stockholder) the goal is to become the richest player in the defined play-time. To achieve this goal, players buy and sell stock. Whoever buys stock, gets shares and then must pay dividends. In the game,it is possible to purchase many stocks, and to unexpectedly be tossed out of control by other players.


Bei Top Aktionär geht es darum, nach Ablauf der festgesetzten Spielzeit der reichste Spieler zu sein.
Zu diesem Zweck kauft und verkauft man Aktien. Wer Aktien besitzt, erzielt Einnahmen und muss auch Dividenden zahlen.
Im Spiel geht es darum, möglichst viele Aktien zu erwerben, aber auch immer für unerwartete Ausgabengerüstet zu sein.

26905.name: Reefer City
26905.description:
Be the king of Pot, Hash and 'Shrooms. You roll dice and progress around the board. In the process you 'make connections' wherein you can buy and sell illegal commodities.
The Market Level for commodity prices will vary as the game goes on. Be the first to accumulate $20,000 and you win!

26906.description:
(from MMP website:)

On September 14th, 1862, the rebel division of D.H. Hill was surprised and attacked by Ambrose Burnside's Wing of the Army of the Potomac. Hill's men held out all day against a rising tide of Federal troops from both the 1st and 9th Corps and were saved only by the late arrival of D.R. Jones and Hood's divisions.

Despite the fact that it was a rather sharp defeat for the rebels, Hill remained justifiably proud of the fight his men managed for 12 long hours atop South Mountain. They had given Lee the time he needed to concentrate his army in the face of a suddenly aggressive Federal force.

South Mountain is the fourth game in the Civil War, Regimental Series. With one map and a manageable number of counters, it is the first game in the series to offer a full, intense, battle that is playable in an evening. And re-playability is very high, given the variable arrival of some key Rebel forces and the application of Confederate and Union Random Events.

Contents:

1 22"x32" mapsheet (sneak peek)
2 countersheets
Civil War Brigade Series rules
Regimental Subsystem rules
South Mountain game specific rules
2 Charts & Tables booklets
Player Aid Card
Two dice




Unit Scale: Regiments and Batteries
Hex Scale: 100 yards/hex
Players: 2 and up
Complexity: Medium


South Mountain creation team:
Designer: Dave Powell
Series Designer & artwork: Dean Essig
Development: Bob Cloyd
26906.name: South Mountain

26907.name: The Bee Safe or Bee Sorry Game
boardgamepublisher: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.
26907.description:
The Bee Safe or Be Sorry Game helps kids be aware of dangers. It features "Stinger" and "Buzzie".

The age recommendation is 4 and up.

The players are represented by playing pieces which are shapes, a square, a circle, a triangle, and a rectangle. There are Honeycomb cards, Stinging Bee cards, Safety First cards, Buzzie Bee cards, Safehouse cards, Stranger Cards, and a spinner.

Players start with three Honeycomb cards and move about the board drawing the other cards. The other cards have situations on them that are to be read and then directions to either move (forwards or backwards) and/or draw/lose Honeycomb cards. The situations all have to do with safety.

Th winner is the first to reach the hive first or obtain 15 Honeycomb cards!

26908.name: Yellowstone Treasure Quest
26908.description: This is a trivia game based on Yellowstone Park - the object to collect unique sets of park "treasures (which are cards of photos for example). Each trivia question has 3 level of difficulties.

26909.name: Walt Disney'n Aku Ankka -noppapeli
26909.description:
This game is a very simple and typical roll and move game, where players try to go from the beginning to the track which has 100 positions. In places where there's a red position instead of a yellow, players encounter different kinds of problems which may affect who's the winner.

Paletti game no. 2893

26910.name: Suuri tietopeli
26910.description:
In this game, the board is built of puzzle pieces at the beginning of the game. Each puzzle piece contains a question category. All the players use the same button, which is moved according to a die throw. The question is asked in the category of where the button gets to. There is also an extra category, which contains yes-no questions of all the categories.

This game seems to be a Finnish version of the game called "Geni!" (http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/22289). This is written in the box cover too. However, there are some differences. For example, in the Finnish version there are 56 puzzle pieces instead of 15 in Geni!

26911.description:
Kick-o-Mania is a dexterity soccer/football game played on a large 4x7 foot playing field. The figures are fully positionable and controlled by your actions.

Rules and a full range of figures and game accessories are available in stores or through the website http://www.kick-o-mania.com
26911.name: Kick-O-Mania

26912.name: Travel 2 Games
26912.description:
[Publisher]
Great on the road, at home, and every place in between. Travel fun for the whole family.
Play I Spy, Road Sign Challenge, and more with 54 colorful cards!

[Submitter]
A collection of simple kid games suitable for playing at travel.
(1) ROAD SIGN DOMINOES - a domino game using road sign paired cards.
(2) ROAD SIGN CHALLENGE - Looking around outside the car for the road sign pictured on card.
(3)I SPY - Looking around to spy the letter (from the drawn card) on license plates, billboards, signs or anywhere else.
(4) I SPY, TOO! - Looking for things that begin with the pictured letter.
(5) ALPHABET TRAVELER - Name a place that begins with the pictured letter.
(6) I'M GOING ON A TRIP... - Make a word chain using words that start with the pictured letter(s), and alternately repeating the word chain plus a new word.

26913.name: Dungeon Dwellers' Fantasy Boardgame
26913.description:
From the publisher:

An entirely new concept in the RPG-boardgame hybrid genre. A d20 based boardgame equally as usable as an occasional distraction or full fledged campaign.

Some features of the boardgame:

d20 ensures a familiar basis and a quality rules set
32 page rule book containing 6 core races, 12 core classes, and 52 unique special abilities
60 full color folding miniatures for your characters, usable for this boardgame or any other purpose
A starter dungeon to get everything started, including full color maps and unique monsters with folding miniatures of their own
Beautiful illustrations by V. Shane, Sacrosanct Games, and Octavirate Entertainment

26915.name: Game, Set & Match
26915.description:
Game, Set & Match is a Tennis board game that uses a die and deck of cards for playing shots, and a board and pawn to show the position of the ball on court.
Players serve by rolling a die marked Ace/Let/In/Out, then if the ball is in play, cards are played for each shot of the rally that determine the stroke played and the position of the ball on the court. Singles or doubles can be played.

26916.description:
The Player's Guide contains articles that describe tips, tactics, strategies, and variants available for Paths of Glory. In addition to the 48-page magazine, the Player's Guide includes 20 new cards and a 1/4 sheet of additional counters.


(from GMT Games's website:)

Features
The Paths of Glory Player's Guide is designed as an expansion kit for your enjoyment of this wonderful game, with exciting and informative articles featuring strategies for you to employ, new scenarios and variants, new playing cards, in-depth analysis of key features in the game, and so much more. Executive Editor Wray Ferrell has put together an excellent team of authors and Managing Editor Stuart K. Tucker's handsome layout design makes reading and utilizing the Player's Guide a pleasure.

Contents and Authors

Strategy

The Opening Guns (Peter P. Perla) - Learn the Giuco Sedano, Warsaw Waltz and Tarnopol Tango in this article that covers a myriad of the many ways to experience August 1914 in Paths of Glory.
Goin' Mobile (Kris Weinschneker) - Play of the Mobilization deck involves some critical choices about War Status and Reinforcements.
Limited War Cards (Kris Weinschneker) - Continuing his discussion of the card decks, Kris offers his suggestions on getting from "Limited" to "Total" war quickly.
Total War Cards (Kris Weinschneker) - Wrapping up his review of the cards, Kris offers some endgame card play suggestions.




New Scenarios and Cards

New Scenarios (Ted Raicer) - The game's designer provides the official starting setups, including card dispositions, for games begun in 1915, 1916, or 1917.
Adding More Paths to Your Deck (Ted Raicer) - Twenty new cards are included as an insert to this magazine. Here are their historical bases.




Analysis

PoG Supply (Ananda Gupta) - The disruption of supply lines can cause the collapse of a front. Each theater has a number of key locations in the defense of those vital supply lines.
Parade of Fools: The Italian Front (Ananda Gupta) - The Italian front offers both promise and danger to both sides, as they attempt to overcome the foibles of their "weak sister" armies.
Optional Rules: Assessing the Balance (Ananda Gupta) - How effective are the mainstream optional rules at establishing a balanced game?




Cybergaming

PBEM Primer (Kris Weinschneker) - A primer on playing Paths of Glory via Play By Email.




Variants

Variant Cards (Tod Reiser) - More card ideas to consider adding to your deck.
Pre-War Options (Ted Raicer) - For those wanting to vary the starting force setup, here are some ideas for each major nation.
Strategic Options (Rick D. Stuart) - Rick provides us with more options to alter game play - some affecting the setup, some used later in the game.
Historical Variants (Brad Martin) - For those seeking to experiment with history and game balance, here are more variant rule ideas.
26916.name: Paths of Glory Player's Guide

26917.description:
From the Publisher´s web
The Harpoon Player's Handbook is a 28 page compilation of all the charts and tables contained in the rulebook. Use of this playing aid greatly assists the flow of play in multiple player games, as all of the data is right at hand, along with references to the appropriate section of the rulebook.


The Harpoon Series


Expands

Harpoon 4
26917.name: Harpoon 4 Player's Handbook

26918.description:
THIS GAME HAS BEEN DISCONTINUED.

Flintlock is a company-level American Revolution gaming at a scale of c.50 yards per hex and about 50 men per counter/unit. The system emphasizes the limits of command, training, and discipline, all in the milieu of the very linear style of warfare in the pre-Napoleonic era. In addition, it uses a most unusual set of mechanics for resolving shock combat. Will you have your troops go into close order, or spread our for better fire possibilities. What are the pros and cons of the rifle-armed American militia? Can your dragoon forces exert any influence?

Flintlock is designed for quick learning and easy play. Game rules are short, but they cover almost every aspect of battle at this micro level. Playing time is less than 2 hours.

The battles chosen highlight small unit tactics in the grueling Southern Campaign, where both sides had ample opportunities to watch, learn and practice, with an emphasis on Formation. Some of the great commanders of the war, from Nathanial Greene and Daniel Morgan to Lord Cornwallis and the infamous, but capable, Banastre Tarleton are in full action.

The Scenario/battles, all (well, most) with armies of one or two thousand men, include:


Camden (17 August 1780) Lord Cornwallis stands and confronts a much larger force under Horatio Gates, but the rebel militia disintegrates and Gates’s army is routed in a major British victory.



Cowpens (17 January 1781) Daniel Morgan conducts a masterful, tactical battle, defeating Banastre Tarleton and destroying the dreaded British Legion in one of the major victories of the war.



Guilford Courthouse (15 March 1781) Nathanial Greene outnumbers Lord Cornwallis by more than two to one. However, the British take the field but with such heavy losses that, in retrospect, Greene could claim a strategic success.



Hobkirk’s Hill (25 April 1781) Nathanial Greene’s Marylanders fail to stand against a concerted charge from Lord Rawdon’s smaller but better disciplined army.
26918.name: Flintlock: Black Powder, Cold Steel -  Volume I: Carolina Rebels

26919.name: The War Game: World War II
26919.description: Fans often call it "Axis and Allies on Steroids". The rules and mechanics are similar enough to Axis and Allies, but there are a few differences and additions. The game, like Axis and Allies, covers the entire war from a strategic level with areas corresponding mostly to countries, with larger countries broken down. The map is a gargantuan 4' x 8' with eight major powers dividing up the non-neutral world (Germany, Italy, Japan, Russia, UK, USA, China, and France)

26920.description:
It is a common form of checkers widely played in the Middle-East, where it is known as Dama.

Played on an 8×8 board, it differentiates with most other games of the Checkers Family because pieces move straight forward or sideways, not diagonally. When a piece reaches the last row it promotes to a flying king (Dama) which moves like the rook in Chess.
26920.name: Turkish Checkers

26921.name: 2 Hour Test Cricket
26921.description: A solo game that enables players to play a complete Test Match in around two hours. You can add individual stats for players, but it adds around 25% to the time to play. A quick, easy and very flexible and exciting game. Perfect for cricket fans who want to play entire series without it becoming a life's work.

26922.name: Commerce
26922.description:
This game is from 1900 and was published by the J. Ottmann Litho Company of New York.

The directions say that Commerce is "the most amusing game on the market"

The game is comprised of a deck of cards with 8 suits
(Pork, Sugar, Cotton, Corn, Coffee, Oats, Flour and Butter) of 6 cards in each suit, making 48 cards in all.

After shuffling the cards, deal each player 6 cards. Each player sorts the cards that they have and then decides which suit they will try to corner.

The object of the game is to obtain all of the cards of one suit by trading with other players.

To play you take from your hand a card or cards of similar suite and holding them up call "Trade 2 or trade 3. All players do that at the same time so there is lots of yelling going on. Sorta like what happens on the New York Stock Exchange. People make trades of cards. So you could trade 2 with someone else then find that the 2 that you receive match a card or two that you already have in your hand and now you might try and trade 3 for 3. When the first player succeeds in getting all of the cards in a suit the player calls "corner" shows the cards to everyone else. First player to get 3 corners wins!

26923.name: Shell Out
26923.description: The game is played on a hexagon board composed of 6 blue triangle fields known as Playing Fields. The Playing Fields are divided by rows of red playing spots running toward the center of the board known as Alleys. These Alleys may be traveled from one end to another in a single move if desired. In each game there are 30 shells divided into groups of 5, each group has a different color. There are also 6 counters numbered 5,10,15,20,25 and 50. At the beginning each player draws a counter, looks at it and then places it beneath one of his shells so that no opponent knows under which shell the counter is. . The object of the game is to move a shell into the SHELL OUT area of an opponent. You may attempt to capture a shell of your opponent. If you are next to a opponents shell you simply jump on it. Most shells have nothing under them and simply result in your losing your shell. If you find the shell with the scoring marker under it you score it. The hand is over when someone moves a loaded shell unto the opponents SHELL OUT area.

26924.description: Appears in Command Magazine Japan #72, 20 Dec 2006, along with SS: Third Reich.
26924.name: The First World War

26925.name: SS: Third Reich
26925.description:
Appearing in Command Magazine Japan #72, 20 Dec 2006, along with First World War.

A multi-player game in which players play German generals fighting for the honor to be the first to reach Moscow.

26926.name: Blue
26926.description:
From the rules: Blue is from the series Factor-5 and is the first jigsaw in which you can compete against other players. You must quickly find suitable pieces to make the jigsaw and then swap the pieces which are the wrong color - you will be surprised by how many possibilities there are.

The game consists of 5 nearly identical jigsaw puzzles of 48 pieces each. There are multiple objects in the picture on the puzzle which are different on each board. All the pieces are then mixed together. Players race to complete the puzzle gaining points for first, second etc. In the second part of the game, players swap pieces to correct errors subtracting incorrect pieces from your score.

26927.name: Plomo y Salitre
26927.description:
Spanish ship-of-the-line game heavily based on Wooden Ships & Iron Men, but set as miniatures rules.

The period covers the Revolutionary and Napoleonic wars at sea and the rules have a complete list of ships available for play of different nations: Spain, Great Britain, France, Portugal, the Ottoman Empire, Russia, Sweden, Holland...

Also includes turns and fire templates for cut and use with the ships.

Home Page (Spanish): http://www.plomoysalitre.com

26928.name: Fortaleses
26928.description:
Fortaleses (Fortress) is a push-your-luck dice game, for 2-5 players.

The players try to build the strongest fortress, using dice towers, and they can, also, attack the fortress of the rest of players.

This game wins the 5th Creation Game Contest in the Fira JocJoc in Tona, Catalonia, Spain in 2006.

26929.name: Rat Race
26929.description:
Rat Race is a card game that is played as fast as possible, all players playing cards simultaneously. Each player has a cheese card in a different maze material (stone, brick, wood, and metal). The cheese card is at the bottom of each player's deck. The rest of the cards are parts of a labyrinth made of the four materials. Players flip over their cards and connect to the existing maze, placing their cards wherever possible. The first player to connect his or her cheese card to the maze wins.

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/rat-race

26930.name: Achtung Panzer
26930.description: A company level game of World War II combat. First in a new series by L2 Design group. The first game includes four geomorphic maps, while other games in the planned series include one on Berlin 1945 and one on Stalingrad which will feature historical terrain.

26932.description:
In this re-themed edition of Ausgerechnet Buxtehude, we are now trying to learn the geographical locations of cities and sights of Switzerland. In the swiss edition, there also cards with mountains.

Players place cards on the table according to their relative location. Other players may doubt the accuracy of the placement you made. Should the accusations turn out to be true, you would have to give out a scoring marker. The player with the most scoring markers in the end wins.

The game includes 200 location cards with longitude, latitude, and other information about locations.
As there are four languages spoken in Switzerland the rules are supplied also in those four languages (German, French, Italian and Rhaeto-Romanic)
26932.name: Usgrächnet Bünzen

26933.description:
Swedish children´s game themed on the Koala Brothers. Players are flying around trying to be the first to visit all their friends. Each player is given 4 tiles, each picturing one of the 9 friends. Up to 9 tiles per player can be used `for a more complex game´. Players roll the die and move on the square grid on the board, visiting squares where the friends are. Friends must be visited in the same order as the tiles in front of the player. Squares are either empty or have a picture of a friend or an airplane. The airplane shows the direction that players must leave that square. First player to visit all 4 (or more) friends is the winner.

Contents:
Game board
4 pawns
36 picture tiles
Die

5 years and up

Note: This game is not identical to Die Koala Brüder: Auf Geht's Nach Haus!(GameID: 21833).
26933.name: Koalabröderna: På flygtur med Frank och Buster

26934.name: The Moose Spotting Game
26934.description: The object of the game is to get 20 or more Moose Spotting points. All players should have the same number of turns before one is declared the champion Moose Spotter.

26935.name: Höjdarna
26935.description: Swedish children´s game themed on the TV-series Höjdarna. Roll the colored die and move towards the air balloon in the middle of the board. If you get the right cards you can move there quicker. Suddenly the balloon will take off. Will you be on board?

26936.name: Bä bä vita lamm
26936.description:
Swedish children´s game. The 36 wooden tiles each show either the front or the back of a lamb on a colored background, so that the tiles match up into 18 lambs with a red background, a green background etc. Players roll the die and turn up tiles. When two tiles match the player may take that lamb. There are black lambs to mess things up. If the die shows the picture of a lamb, the first player to sound like a lamb may take one lamb from any player. The player with the most lambs is the winner.

Contents:

36 wooden tiles
Die
Rules

26937.description:
Swedish card game featuring Alfons and friends from the books and short films by Gunilla Bergström. 58 cards are dealt equally among the players. One card is placed face-up on the table. The starting player turns up the top card from his deck. If it is the same character as the open card, or if the balloons on the cards are the same color, the player plays the card on a common pile and continues turning his cards. When the cards don´t match the player discards his card and the next player turns up his top card. If a player turns up a card that is both the same character and the same balloon color as the open card, he may put all his discards on the pile. Players may have to turn their discard pile into a new draw deck. The first player to run out of cards is the winner.

No decisions to make at all, but an easy game for small kids.
26937.name: Alfons kortspel

26938.name: The National Bicycle Game
26938.description: Early 20th century roll and move Bicycle race game. The colorful board represents a 100 mile race. Published in Australia.

26939.name: Tour de France
26939.description:
A very different type of roll and move game.

The board has been replaced by two rolled paper bands in plastic boxes. The Bikes with riders sit on top.

Dice are rolled to determine how far your rider goes, but instead of moving the rider across a board, you simply turn the rollers to advance the roll (which serves as the tracks).

26940.name: Nitty Gritty
26940.description:
Nitty Gritty: The Star Game

If you are an eager beaver, here's your chance to get even steven with any funny bunny, providing you don't get into double trouble in which case any hanky panky could become hairy scary. So don't dilly dally, but get down to the nitty gritty so you can razzle dazzle without phoney baloney - and that, silly Billy, is super duper. Does this sound like mumbo jumbo? (From the box)

The game consists of 154 printed cards which, when properly matched with each other, make 77 pairs. Pair examples are: Mellow Yellow / Roly Poly / Plain Jane / Hebbie Jebbies...etc.

Each of the 154 cards has one word and from one to three stars printed on the face of the card. The number of stars indicates the value of the card.

The purpose of the game is to win as many matched pairs of cards as possible. When the stockpile of cards is gone, the player with the greatest number of stars is the winner.

26941.description: Roll and move bicycle race game set in the Alps. Austrian publisher.
26941.name: Vier Länder Tour

26942.description:
A scenario pack for Critical Hit's Advance Tobruk System (ATS).

The package contains two maps and 6 scenarios all covering actions on the Western Front in 1944.

Note that no rules and counters are provided so that ownership of other games in this system (e.g. Scottish Corridor) and/or spare countersheets obtainable from Critical Hit is required to play.

Expands

Advanced Tobruk
Scottish Corridor: Lion Rampant
26942.name: Hot Stove Pack 1

26943.name: Big Jim: Il Giro D'Italia
26943.description:
Bicycle race game from Mattel Italy. Features dice that include results with fatigue, punctures and energy.

Has 2 2-sided boards for 4 different race courses

26944.description:
From publisher's website:

After the death of the beloved Royal Mage of the kingdom, the king of the land set out a challenge to find his replacement. Wizards from far and wide came to vie for the position. As the challenge was set forth a few of the smarter and sneakier ones thought of a good way to get a leg up. They made their way into the secret dungeon of the former Royal Mage and decided to loot it for what they needed to win... But only one can win, so the battle for the loot began.

Lootin' Wizards is a fun group card/board game where you race around the randomly placed dungeon, trying to get more loot than your opponents. Make spells to battle each other, using the ingenious three card spell system (for thousands of possible creations). Screw up their spells with troublesome Side Effects. Foil them with entertaining Trap cards. Use helpful Items to aid your quest to grab all the Loot you can.

http://www.dragavangames.com/
26944.name: Lootin' Wizards

boardgamehonor: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best DTP-Produced Boardgame Nominee
2007 Charles S. Roberts Best DTP-Produced Boardgame Winner
26945.description:
From Khyber Pass Games website
George Armstrong Custer and The Battle of the Little Bighorn have long overshadowed the Battle of the Rosebud. Preceding the Little Bighorn by a week, the outcome of this battle directly influenced what happened to Custer and the 7th US Cavalry.
General George Crook was given command of the Southern column of the Bighorn Campaign. With Gibbon's column coming in from the West and the Terry/Custer column from the Northeast, the campaign's objective was to trap the Sioux and Northern Cheyenne and forcibly return them back to their reservation.
Tactically the battle was inconclusive. Casualties on both sides were relatively low, and in the end Crook held the field. But strategically the Rosebud fight was a great victory for the Sioux and Cheyenne. Crook expended a huge amount of ammunition; most soldiers were down to 10 rounds or fewer each. Many horses were killed, injured, or worn out. Because of these reasons Crook decided to withdraw his command back to his base camp, effectively taking his column out of the campaign.
Had Crook been able to continue operations he could have linked up with Custer's column, adding his infantry and cavalry to the 7th Cavalry. Custer's last stand would have, in all probability, never have occurred.
Game scale:
Each combat unit represents:
- one US Cavalry company
- approximately 100 Indians
- individual leader
Each hex equals 1/4 mile across.
Each game turn represents 20 minutes.

This game will be re-released by Legion Wargames as a boxed game with die-cut EasyPunch counters. Also being re-released is Volume I in the series Battle of the Little Bighorn.

This game is part of a series: Battle of the Rosebud, Battle of the Little Bighorn, and Battle of Adobe Walls.
26945.name: Battle of the Rosebud
boardgamefamily: Indian Wars of the American West

26946.description:
Amigo's Ladybohn: Manche mögen's heiss! (Some like it hot!) is a standalone game, which is the marriage of Bohnanza and the Ladybohn expansion, with babies added to the mix.

This game features 112 cards, which include reworked distributions of the basic beans from Bohnanza: For instance, in Ladybohn: Manche mögen's heiss!, there are still 6 Gartenbohnen, but now 4 are male, 1 is female, and 1 is a baby; there are 21 Blauen Bohnen, 11 of which are male, with 5 females and 5 babies. As with Ladybohn, the female beans have better beanometers than the male beans, so if you harvest a field with a lady on top, its worth is greater. The new babies have no beanometer, meaning that harvesting a field topped by a baby is worthless; however, when a baby is planted in a field, a female bean in the field can ascend past two cards, so the babies can bring the superior females where they are needed most.

Part of the Bohnanza family of games. It is now included in the stand-alone expansion Bohnanza: Ladies & Gangsters.
26946.name: Ladybohn: Manche mögen's heiss!

26947.name: Italian Checkers
26947.description:
It is the national form of checkers in Italy, where it is called Dama.
Played on an 8×8 board (rotate 90 degree with respect to Checkers, it differentiates with most other games of the Checkers Family because men can't jump kings. Another peculiarity are the jump rules, which define with more cases which move is compulsory in case of multiple possible jumps.

Men move and capture only diagonally forward. Kings move and capture diagonally forwards and backwards but don't fly.

This game can be played online at Ludoteka

26948.name: Conga
26948.description: Conga is a two-dimensional game which combines characteristics of Mancala games with four in a row. One players uses 10 black seeds, the other 10 white seeds. Players start with their cache of seeds in opposite corners of the board. The contents of a pit are distributed into the succeeding pits in a particular manner not unlike the "sowing" that happens in Mancala games. The object of the game is to form a row of four occupied holes (the colors of the seeds don't matter), diagonally or orthogonally. In addition, you win if your opponent can't move.

26949.name: Get Better Bear
26949.description: Play doctor and be the first to make the teddy bear better. Move your character around the board, placing bandages on boo-boos as you go. Watch out for gauzy shortcuts. When you reach the lollipop, flip it over and put it on the bears mouth. You made him smile and you win.

26950.name: Combination Board 4 Games
26950.description:
Combination Board, 4 Games (boxed):
Manufactured by Wilder Mfg. Co., St. Louis, MO., U.S.A., around 1920, before they carved up Germany and Austria-Hungary and created Poland, etc., because the map matches 1918 Europe.
This set of 4 games (designed for 2 to 4 players) in one box includes two folding game boards with a game on each side. The four games are: 1. Indian Home Game (looks and plays like Parcheesi); 2. Game Hunt (move around the board scoring points for shooting critters -- Rabbit = 1, Lion = 12); 3. Army and Navy (move around a map of WWI Europe, scoring points for capturing enemy officers and weapons -- Zeppelin = 1, Flag and General = 10); 4. Auto Race (race around a track, avoid obstacles, cross finish line 1st).

Contents: Two 12" x 12" mounted game boards with a different game on each side, 16 1/2-inch round wooden playing pieces (4 red, 4 yellow, 4 green, 4 blue), and 1D6 (wooden) in a 6.5" x 14" x 1.5" flat box. The rules for 3 games are inside the lid; the Auto Race game has the rules right on the board.

26951.name: Börja läsa
26951.description:
A game in Kärnan´s line of wooden games for children. This is an educational game to help children learn to read and write. The game features 77 wooden tiles with letters and 8 double-sided boards with pictures and some letters. Players connect tiles to make the words matching the picture on each line.

5 years and up.

26952.description:
A member of the Checkers Family common in The Netherlands, France and Russia.

International Checkers is played just like American Checkers or British draughts, with the exception that it is played on a 10x10-square checker board with twenty pieces per player. This game is played mostly in European countries like France, The Netherlands, Russia, Poland and Belgium and in African nations like Congo, Senegal and Ivory Coast. However, there are countries outside these two continents that boast of good players like in the United States, Italy, Israel and Brazil.

Rules of the Game: This game is played on a 10 x 10, or 100 squares checker board where the double corner is on the right of each player.

The Moves of the Men: Checkers pieces can move forward on each empty square to the left or to the right. When these pieces reach the last line on the opponent's side they become kings.

The Moves of the King: Kinged pieces can move across multiple squares on the two diagonals that cross their position for so long as these squares are open, in a rule known as the "flying kings."

Captures: In International checkers, maximum captures are obligatory, which means that if a player has more than one path to jump to capture his opponent's pieces, he must take that path that will effect the most capture of his opponent's pieces. If a piece lands on the king row during a jump, it must continue jumping backward for as long as there is a jump opportunity. That particular piece cannot be kinged unless it finishes the move and stops on king row.

Captures by the Men: Men can effect capture by moving forward or backward and jumping over a single piece of the opponent provided that the said piece is adjacent to it and the following square is empty. If the man can jump again from the arrival square to effect another capture, then it must do so.

Captures by a King: A kinged piece can capture an opponent's piece if it is on the same diagonal where it is positioned provided that the squares between them are empty and that the square beyond the piece to be captured is also empty. The king can stop on any square within the same diagonal line and if another capture can be effected from any of these squares, then it must continue to do so.

The Winning Player: The player who cannot move any of his pieces loses the game.

Conditions for a Draw:

By mutual agreement of the players.
Both players have played five moves, after a position arises of one king against two pieces, which includes a king.
Both players have played sixteen moves, after a position arises of one king against three pieces, which includes a king.
Both players have moved twenty five moves solely with kings and not a single piece was captured.
For the third time the same position arises with the same player at move.




Information from checkershistory.com

Online Play

Boardspace.net (real time play against humans, or play against the computer)
26952.name: International Checkers

26953.description: Rumble Robots was a children's collectible card game sold in starter decks and booster packs circa 2001. The premise is based around warring factions of sci-fi robots. There are two sides: a blue team of good guys, and a red team of bad guys, each lead by a robot king. The blue king is King El Smasho and the red king is King Slugnut. The cards themselves are called Power Cards and contain bar codes for interaction with Rumble Robots toys. Each card has a "power level" from 1-5 which corresponds to both its rarity and relative usefulness in the game. In addition, there are "platinum" cards, more powerful than level 5 cards. One expansion set was released, "Rumble Robots: Invasion", which focused on the two king characters as well as adding a further rarity level called "superpower" cards.
26953.name: Rumble Robots Invasion

26954.name: Hold the Phone
26954.description: All players must hold hands to make Tommy the telephone talk. Tommy tells you what picture to find by making silly sounds. When Tommy says Time's Up, the person with the most discs wins.

26955.name: Snoopy Card Game
26955.description: The Snoopy Card Game board consists of eight popular Peanuts characters--Charlie Brown, Sally, Lucy, Schroeder, Peppermint Patty, Woodstock, Franklin and Linus. Players try to march along the paw-print path to the finish by matching cards from their hands with the characters on the board. By collecting "scoring bowls" players move one, two, three or four spaces at a time. Each round ends with players drawing a card from the player to their right. Amongst the various character cards are eight "Snoopy Ha-Ha" cards which serve as dead spots in your hand since none of them can match the characters on the board. First player to reach the finish is the winner.

26956.name: Cranium Super Showdown
26956.description:
From the publisher's site:

Cranium Super Showdown will get your family thinking and creating in illogically logical ways!

Pick wacky challengers to take on crazy contests, like monster truck rallies and bubble-gum bubble blowing. Who would win a pie-eating contest: a monkey with backup dancers or a pirate on a pogo stick? It's up to the judge!

Have laugh-out-loud fun stating your case, flexing your logic skills, and earning trophies. With Super Showdown, everyone gets to be the judge, and Everyone Shines!

26957.name: Med vilda gester
26957.description: Party game where players act out words and their teammates try to guess the word. Basically it´s charades, but you may make sounds and whistle tunes as long as you don´t use actual words.

26959.name: Scrambled Eggs
26959.description:
Each player tries to match the color and shape inside the egg with the ones on their cards. The first player to match all their cards to the eggs wins.

Ages 3-7.

26960.name: Montabaur
26960.description:
This game is a memory-variant with pictures of the city or region the game is developed for. There are many different editions for about 200 cities or regions in Germany.

Each pair of tiles has a set of corresponding questions on it, where each tiles also gives the answer to the other one.
This way, several trivia-games can be played. Two special dice are included.

The rules describe 7 different way of plays.

26961.description:
Easter Island is a tiny triangular speck of land at the eastern edge of Polynesia in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. The island has fascinated travelers, mystics, and scientists for years as people have wondered how such a small, isolated area could have been home to a society that created the world's most spectacular outdoor museum. In the 1940s, Norwegian archeologist Thor Heyerdahl sailed the reed boat Kon-Tiki from South America to Easter Island to show that the technology available made it possible for Polynesia to be settled from the Americas. In the 1970s, Erich Van Daniken popularized the idea that the world was visited by ancient astronauts and the beautiful and enormous stone statutes, the Moai, of Easter Island were used as some of his "evidence."

Today, scientists around the world generally agree that Easter Island was settled from other Polynesian islands to its west, and the extreme culture that produced hundreds of stone Moai is related to other cultures in the region. The history of the island is a history of constraint, and the carving of the Moai, the rapid deforestation of the island, and the limited food sources available all worked together to build an extreme culture that became the victim of its own consumption. In this way, Easter Island today represents more than just a wonderful place to travel, but also is a reminder of the greater resource limits of our entire planet. As populations continue to grow and we put further strains on sources of fuel and food, are we heading toward the same fate that this small island suffered hundreds of years ago? The island today is owned by Chile, and the small population thrives with a few weekly flights to mainland South America and the occasional cargo ship visit.

Moai is a game that closely follows the developments and excesses of the island until the arrival of Dutch Admiral Jacob Roggeveen, the first European to discover the island and name it for the day of his discovery. Combining many of the historical features of the island's culture in an exciting and well-playing strategic game, players can have fun reliving the dramatic history of this exciting little island.
26961.name: Moai
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 2 - Picking Over the Bones

26962.name: Monopoly: Reading
26962.description: An edition of the commercially successful board game, Monopoly. This edition takes in the English town of Reading. Popular and well known landmarks are for sale including the Madejski Stadium, the Abbey Ruins and The Oracle shopping centre. Local companies and organisations logos feature prominently on the gameboard.

26964.name: Kaart tennis
26964.description:
At first sight this "card tennis" game resembles the game Tennis ( http://boardgamegeek.com/game/2841 ) a lot. On close examination, however, there are differences which will be discussed underneath.
First of all it should be noted that the (c) from this game is 1973: two years before Tennis was released! Further, on the box it says (literal translation) "The first and only cardgame on the world based on tennis". The box furthermore states that the game was issued on occasion of the 75th year of the Dutch Tennis Association. However, a publisher cannot be found on box, or on rule sheets. Based on these data I do believe that this was the predecessor of Tennis.
Differences with Tennis: a) In this game there is no 'ball' nor a pawn (you just move the stack of played cards to the correct position). b) Cards are strictly for either backhand or forehand strokes (indicated with either B or F). c) There are more rules of which card may be played on what card (eg. smash may only following a lob).

26965.name: Dungeon Escape
26965.description:
Be the first to collect all the treasures and escape from the dungeon.

Dungeon Escape is a roll and move, dungeon crawl themed game for children ages 7 and up. Move your two children through the maze while avoiding the guards, who will send a player's piece back to the keep. Before a player's piece can exit the dungeon it must land on each of the four marked treasure spaces - Sword, Jewel, Book of Spells, and Key - and collect the corresponding treasures.

26966.name: Shieldwall
26966.description:
The game takes its theme from the formation of the Saxon Shieldwall in an abstract form. The pieces reflect this being resin cast representations of stylized Norman and Saxon Infantry.
The objective of Shieldwall is to capture positions to the rear of the opponent's flanks. Offensive pieces can only attack in pairs and the defending pieces can be formed into stronger units called Shieldwalls.
The Designer claims that the rules are easy to learn yet the depth of strategy belies its apparent simplicity.

Home Page: http://www.shieldwall.co.uk/index.html

26967.name: The Game of the Wizard of Oz
26967.description:
A roll and move game in which players move counters from different initial positions: Dorothy starts in Kansas, the other players in positions ahead of her (Scarecrow, Tin Man, and Lion, in that order.) The point of the game is to reach the Witch's Castle and then return to the Emerald City.

Similar in design and mechanics to the game Kentucky Derby (1938), and of typical quality of other Whitman Publishing games (paper boards, flimsy boxes, and punch-out paper pawns of other games) it looks as if Whitman didn't spend a lot on the construction of their games, apparently blowing all their budget on the purchase of the character license.

The game contains:

Linen paper game board
1 dice
4 wooden markers
Two part box with color pictorial cover (measuring 7"x13"x1")

The featured art, though crude, is apparently inspired by the MGM Wizard Of Oz movie.

26968.name: Block the Clock
26968.description:
Look out...here comes the runaway clock!

Players must arrange the tiles and create a "track" for the oncoming clock before the alarm goes off and it's too late!

The clock has speed levels for players who dare to rev up the frantic fun in this family game of split second action.

A cross between a sliding 15 puzzle and a pipeline game.

26969.name: Robber Barons of the Gilded Age
26969.description: Some superficial similarities to Monopoly such as Board shape and pawn movement. Players build up Wealth and Economic Resources. However to win, you have to have the best Legacy, which means you must convert some of that wealth into philanthropy before the game ends. Monopolies are based on 20 different Industries including Oil, Banking, Railroads, Steel, etc. Players can own holdings within the same space. Not complex but it does offer lots of period flavor. A complete copy of the rules are available for free at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/RBGA.html

26970.name: Donner Knispel
26970.description:
Donner Knispel is very much like Pachisi, but instead of dice rolling, movement is done by playing cards. Card have values and special abilities, what makes the game much more tactical than Pachisi.

With 4 players it is a partner game and your partner´s pieces can be moved with your own cards.

The game is set in the children's fantasy world of Donner Knispel.

Home Page: http://www.myfleat.com/

26971.name: Dick Tracy Crime Stopper
26971.description:
Twenty clue slides are randomly placed in the slots on the gameboard. One of the eight criminal portraits is chosen secretly and placed inside the gameboard. The portrait is now hidden by the clue slides.

Each player, in turn, spins the spinner. The spinner will tell the player which two clues may be removed from the gameboard. The player may then guess which of the eight portraits is concealed by the slides by pressing the appropriate button on the gameboard. If the word "guilty" lights up, then the player has solved the mystery and won the game.

The game uses one "D" battery and a standard flashlight's bulb.

26973.name: Jagabongo
26973.description:
From the Box:

A new intergenerational board game for family and friends. A game of luck, chance and strategy. Can be played in combinations of two, four or eight players. The object of the game is to fill your chosen colored areas, and to collect opponent's Jabongs.

Contains two Jagabongo boards, 64 Colored Jabongs and 3 Jates, one rule card and one bag.

Age 7+

26974.name: Djurens fantastiska värld
26974.description:
Swedish trivia game about animals (The Fantastic World of Animals). On their turn, players choose their own task for that turn by playing a card from their hand. The categories are charade, picture quiz or one of five different categories of questions, e.g. “Animals in the air”. There are also wild cards. If the player succeeds in her task, she discards her task card. The first player to loose all her cards is the winner. When playing a charade card, the player has one minute to perform the charade. If another player makes the correct guess, then that player may discard any one card from her hand. The player performing the charade may also discard a card because the charade was a success.

8 years and up

26975.description:
Children´s game featuring Tummen (The Thumb), the character from the books of Inger Sandberg. Players roll the die and pick pieces from the box. Pieces have different colors on either end, e.g. yellow/blue pieces, red/green pieces. Each player is trying to make the longest row by connecting ends of the same color. If the die shows the Tummen side the player make take any piece, even from an opponent. This is where the puppets are used: The puppet is put on the player´s thumb and pointed at the piece the player wants. Longest row of pieces wins.

Contents:
49 puzzle pieces
Die w/ labels
4 thumb puppets
Rules

4 years and up
26975.name: Tummenspelet

26976.description:
Kingdom Hearts is a Japanese trading card game based on the the video game Kingdom Hearts. In this game, you fight against the forces of evil and darkness. In order to do so, you call on allies from the worlds of Final Fantasy and Disney. With their help, you can overcome the hordes of "heartless", evil minions of darkness and despair.

Home Page: http://www.fantasyflightgames.com/kingdomhearts/
26976.name: Kingdom Hearts TCG

26977.description: Game about the Mille's Sicilian campaign, the first campaign of Garibaldi against the Regno delle Due Sicilie. The game has 1 map, 107 counters and rules.
26977.name: I Mille

26978.name: Travel Time Spinner Game
26978.description: Travel Time is a car themed spin-and-move game given as a toy with meal by Ruby's Diners. Players move their car down a twisty road, following the instructions on the spaces. Completely random and similar to Snakes and Ladders, though thankfully shorter.

26979.description:
Swedish children´s game featuring the characters Pettson and his cat Findus. Players help them make a birthday cake and celebrate. They roll the die and collect chits featuring parts of the cake. If you get a chit with a muckla (the small ever present creatures from the books) you must give away a birthday present to another player. The first player to have a complete cake with candles, and who has received 2 birthday gifts, is the winner.

Contents:

Gameboard
colored die
42 small chits
48 big chits
Cloth bag
Rules
26979.name: Pettson och Findus födelsedagsspel

26980.name: Abeltje het spel
26980.description:
Game released in honor of the Dutch movie Abeltje (personal name of an elevator boy). On its turn the movie was based on a children's book by a famous Dutch writer: Annie M.G. Schmidt.

The game itself is a simple roll-and-move system, where some spots have a special meaning, sometimes requiring trivia questions about the movie.

Land on an elevator to move one floor up. Reach the top floor to win the game.

26981.name: Tour de france
26981.description:
Yet another very simple TdF game, with a (more-or-less) 3D-board. No date provided, but must be somewhere in the sixties (after the Dutch Jan Janssen won the Tour in '68?). Distributed by a large Dutch warehouse chain.

Use the spinner to determine the number of spots to move forward. Landing on 20 is (for some reason) mandatory to proceed.

This game was released in the Netherlands by Hema and in Germany by Multiplay.

26982.name: The Kama Sutra Game
26982.description:
From the back of the game:

For more than a thousand years Kama Sutra has been a guide for lovers of all ages. We have interpreted this great work and offer it to a couple as an interactive game experience.

The Kama Sutra Game™ offers lovers the opportunity to explore the sensual and sexual aspects of their body, mind and spirit on the journey to experiencing ecstasy.

Object of the Game
- To have fun developing a deeper understanding of what you and your lover like and want in your intimate relationship.

- To engage in an extended session of lovemaking that builds on anticipation, creativity, adventure and a progression of physical intimacy.

- To expand your sensory awareness through activities using sight, hearing, taste, smell and... touch.

Game Play
Rolling the die and moving your game piece each of you will travel a different path. During the game the two of you will be communicating, sharing and participating in a multitude of pleasurable activities and accumulating "Sexual Position" cards. These cards will be played to complete your "journey to ecstasy."

Included in the game:
A playing board, 56 activity and position cards, a die, 2 playing pieces and instructions.

A Journey to Ecstasy awaits you!

26983.description:
Dorn is a fantasy strategic role-playing game. One of the players is the Dorn Keeper, who each turn spawns various new monsters. Five heroes need to battle the monsters, collect three sacred artifacts and finally defeat the Dorn Keeper.

The game uses no dice in combat (a hero kills a weak monster, wounds a stronger one; more than one monster is needed to wound a hero), has superb graphics and includes variety of options and skills to ensure replayability - players can choose from nine heroes, various items can be found on the board, some passages are randomly blocked, the Dorn Keeper can cast different special spells in each game, etc.)

Both heroes and the Dorn Keeper can advance in levels, thus gaining new skills (heroes by gaining experience from slain monsters, Dorn Keeper by causing enough wounds to heroes).

Home Page: http://www.dorn.cz (Czech)
26983.name: Dorn

26984.name: Vi i femman
26984.description:
Themed on a Swedish TV-quiz for school kids, this game pits 2-4 players or teams against each other. Players answer questions and perform tricky tasks with a time limit. Score markers are moved on a track, and some spaces on the track will trigger a die roll that decides whether players score positive or negative points. This adds a considerable random element.

Contents:
Scoring track
4 pawns
4 White boards
4 pencils and erasers
330 cards
10 topic cards
10 topic markers
Die
Timer
4 puzzles
1 plastic stand

10 years and up

26985.name: Svensson frågar, Svensson svarar
26985.description:
The name Svensson is Sweden´s equivalent to Smith, and the title means Svensson asks, Svenssons answers. In this game players earn points by answering trivia questions but also by correctly guessing how many Swedes (in %) have correctly answered the same question on www.vetgirig.nu. People have also submitted questions for the game on the website.

Contents:
Gameboard
3 decks of cards
4 pawns
1 notepad
Rules

14 years and up

26986.name: Retro
26986.description:
Swedish trivia game about the 50´s, 60´s, 70´s, 80´s and 90´s. The main focus is on popular culture, sports etc.

Contents:
Gameboard
375 cards
25 markers
Notepad
5 pencils
5 pawns
Die
Rules

26987.description:
Pilare is a board game designed by the Basque game author Jorge Gómez Arrausi. It won a Proxime Accessit award in the Concurs de Creació de Jocs de Tona, 2005 ("Games Creation Contest of Tona").

Pilare is a stacking game in which pieces are moved in a way that resembles the sowing in Mancala games.
26987.name: Pilare

26988.name: Labans spökspel
26988.description:
Swedish children´s game featuring spöket Laban (Little ghost Godfrey) from the books by Inger and Lasse Sandberg. The friendly ghost must practice some ghostly sounds. Players move around the board, representing the castle, and collect and imitate various sounds. The winner is the player who is the first to reach the Ghost Room and make the Great Ghostly Bawl.

Contents:
26 sound markers with drawings of cats, owls, cars etc.
4 key markers
4 pawns with plastic stands
Die
Rules

26989.name: The Fall of Bataan
26989.description: The Fall of Bataan is a two-player game of the American defense of the Bataan Peninsula against the Japanese in 1942. The mapsheet shows the major portion of the Bataan peninsula and the island of Corregidor. The game lasts 10 turns; at the end victory is evaluated based on the number of American units left on the map.

boardgamehonor: 2008 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Nominee
26990.description:
Container is a game about big ships and big production. Each player will play both as a producer and shipper of goods. Players will decide which products they want to produce, and which of the OTHER players' goods they want to ship out to a remote island. During these phases, players will be able to set the prices for their goods and try to maximize their cash!

Once the goods have reached the island, players will play the part of the purchaser for their tiny island. Players bid for the goods arriving each day by ship, and the highest bidder collects these goods for conversion into points at the end of the game.

Sounds simple? It is! But the real challenge is turning your home production into goods for your island. Your government is willing to subsidize your purchases, but just how much money do you want to give to your competitors for that lovely crate of goods your island desperately needs?

Online Play

Boardspace.net (real time, AI option)
26990.name: Container
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGTG 95 - SR & Feedback (Container & Chicago Express)
Episode 14: Container
ET71: Amiguete.. ¿nos hacemos unos Containers? Pero sin New Eras ¿eh?
Heavy Cardboard Episode 25 – Container
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
Heavy Cardboard Episode 59 – December (2016) Briefing
I've Been Diced! episode 11: How many sessions before judgment?
OBG 018: The Culture of Game Consumption

26991.name: Les Ribauds
26991.description:
Goal of this game is to become the richest and the Ribaud with most influence in the city. "Ribaud" is an ancient French word which describes a person who likes luxury and extravagance.
You lead a team of crooks which you assign missions to. Each round consists of about 10 phases:
- Draw of a Season Card
- Liberation or execution of arrested team members
- Purchase of Event cards
- Announcement of a "big coup" and negotiation between players
- Secret placement of playing pieces
- Intervention of the police
- Taking back of playing pieces
- Solution of the "big coups"
- Income of players
- Occupation of streets (and new turn)

After 8 rounds the grand winner is determined.

26992.name: Kauf bei Mir
26992.description:
From the promotional packaging inside of Zitadelle, viewable in Image 138790.

We need bread, meat, salt, fruit, dishes, and many more things for our household. We can find these wares in five stores, or we can buy them in the countryside. A new game that combines a lotto game with the ideals of a dice game.

26993.name: Teufelsrad
26993.description:
From the promotional packaging inside of Zitadelle, viewable in Image 138790.

An interesting and varied board game. Like in the game Halma, players must get their pieces into an opposite field. However, the way to get there is over a turntable that one is allowed to turn one quarter, so long as there is another piece in the goal. That is how the fortune of the party will most change.

Game rules:

This game can be played with up to 4 players.
Each player gets 10 meeples, of which 6 are
to be moved into the opposite destination spaces
of the same color.

The starting player is determined by chance.
The meeples can jump over other meeples of the same
or any other color to get to the destination
spaces (jumping is done like in the Halma game).

Every time a player gets one of his meeples on a
destination space, the turntable gets turned a quarter
turn to the right.

This provides for variety in the gameplay, because
every turn changes the position of the meeples
for every player.

The winner is the player, who is the first to get 6
meeples on the destination spaces.

The 4 remaining meeples are without importance for the
